When visiting Ivonne’s home, in addition to being welcomed with kindness, one would find a ceramics workshop where she produces all types of decorations maD. by using cold and heat. She also offers the services of her kiln. Ivonne also produces plaster figurines, paintings, and wood sculptures. She restores all types of artifacts that people appreciate, but believe have been lost.

Ivonne is always willing to teach because she believes this creative tradition is a gift from God so that society can continue. She is a woman who has always been supported by her family. Since she is happy and self-taught, Ivonne enjoys her work and receives immense personal satisfaction. For her, there is no other type of work because it helps her to remain calm in times of stress and provides her an outlet for artistic expression.

Five years ago she joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that has helped Ivonne improve her management skills so that she can increase her sales and her profits. Her dream going forward is to establish an art school for young people. At the moment, she is applying for a Kiva loan so that she can invest in raw materials for making ceramic handicrafts. Ivonne always has a good energy level and all the creative potential to pour into her work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making ceramic handicrafts.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda's group is comprised of hard working women. Brenda is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her small retail business which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies,  like sugar, and will help Brenda to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Brenda’s future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like sugar.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel worked for over 15 years as a physical therapist with handicapped and disabled adults. Her work was physically demanding, and after suffering a back injury she could not go back to this field. Instead of giving up she decided to develop a business activity. She started selling jewelry, handbags and cosmetics that she bought and restyled from her home. Marcel was able to sell items even cheaper than available at the souk market.

Marcel needed this loan to renovate her workstation and purchase additional stock.  She dreams of continuing to branch out into additional items and utilizing her sewing and artistic skills. One day she wants to open a store on the main street of her village and broaden her business' potential.

loans.use: renovate her workstation and purchase stock

loans.name: Baekissou

texts.fr:
Mme Baekissou est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 20ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des pagnes, des boucles d’oreille, des berceaux pour bébé et des produits cosmétiques etc. depuis 07ans. L’argent va servir à l’achat de pagnes, boucles d’oreille et des produits cosmétiques Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes.

Elle veut s’acheter 50 pièces de pagnes 30 complets de boucle d’oreille et 30 cartons de produit cosmétiques.

Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son hangar. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique  de pagnes et de produits de beauté.
texts.en:
Mrs Baekissou is married and the mother of two children: the elder is 23 and the younger 20. None of them attends school. She has six people in her care.

She has been selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth), earrings and cosmetics for seven years. She gets her supplies at the great market in Ouagadougou. Her clientele is made up of women and men. She wants to buy 50 units of pagnes, 30 sets of earrings and 30 boxes of cosmetics.

Mrs Baekissou intends to use her profit to expand her shed. Her ambition is to open a large store for pagnes and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy 50 units of pagnes, 30 sets of earrings and 30 boxes of cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Azucena es socia del banco comunal Las Atenas Patillanas del Distrito Yarinacocha D. Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 49 años D. edad, casada, cuatro hijos, solo uno está a su cargo.
Son 22 ciclos que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a la crianza D. aves D. corral en pequeña escala, acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su huerta para poner pollos bebes D. granja, que en un mes ya estarán listos para sacar al mercado.
Cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo que es el que se encarga D. la comercialización D. los pollos cuando se encuentran con el peso adecuado.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 100 pollos bebes. 2 sacos D. inicio, 1 frasco D. vitaminas, 5 sacos D. viruta, un frasco D. vacunas, 1 galón D. creso para desinfectar  los ambientes.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad D. tener su propio negocio para el beneficio D. toda su familia, por el trabajo ahora tienen mayor comunicación y lo más importante están unidos.
texts.en:
Azucena is a member of the “Las Atenas Patillanas” communal bank in Yarinacocha District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 49 years old, married and has four children but only one who is still in her care.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos for 22 cycles.  She raises barnyard fowl in small scale; she equipped a small space in her farm to raise baby chicks that will be ready to take to market in one month’s time.  Her husband helps her since he’s the one who takes care of selling them when they reach adequate weight.

She will use her new, 2000 new sol, loan to buy 100 baby chicks, 2 sacks of feed, 1 jar of vitamins, 5 sacks of wood chips, 1 jar of vaccine and 1 gallon of Creso [brand of disinfectant] to disinfect the coops.

She thanks Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to have her own business for the benefit of her entire family.  Because of this work they now have better communication and they are together which is most important.

loans.use: to buy 100 baby chicks, 2 sacks of feed, 1 jar of vitamins, 5 sacks of wood chips and one jar of vaccine.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn has been engaged in her rice farm business for fifteen years and she usually earns P45,000 per crop year. She is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family out of poverty.

Erlyn is married to a farmer who helps her manage their farm. According to her, through the income generated from her business, she had been able to give daily allowances to her children who are currently in school.

At this time, she is requesting a loan of P20,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production

loans.name: Khaka W/g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khaka W/G Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Josephine is the facilitator of the Khaka W/G Group. She takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed her family and produce quality farm produce. In the recent 2011 season, Josephine had a very good maize yield harvesting sixteen bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Josephine was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Josephine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Josephine will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Khaka W/G Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
Josephine is pictured with her group members in the photograph above.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Edgar Benito

texts.es: EDGAR ES CASADO, TIENE 46 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 3 HIJOS QUIENES ASISTEN AL COLEGIO MAS CERCANO A SU DOMICILIO, EL INICIO SU NEGOCIO HACE NUEVE AÑOS, DEBIDO  A QUE SE QUEDO DESEMPLEADO INICIO VENDIENDO PRODUCTOS LACTEOS,  LUEGO EMPEZO A VENDER CHICHARRONES EN LAS CALLES TRES DIAS A LA SEMANA POR OTRO LADO TAMBIEN SE DEDICO A LA VENTA DE PONCHOS, COLCHAS Y VAJILLAS POR PAGOS, EL SOLICITA UN CREDITO PARA PODER INVERTIR EN MAS MERCADERIA, COMO EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS DE USOS DOMESTICOS POR QUE YA SE ACERCA LA TEMPORADA NAVIDEÑA EN LA CUAL HAY MAS DEMANDA DE VENTAS, EL SUEÑO MAS GRANDE ES TERMINAR DE PAGAR SU CASA PARA DEJARLES UN LUGAR DONDE VIVIR A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en: Edgar, 46, is married and has three children who attend school near their home.  He started his business nine years ago after he lost his job and began selling dairy products.  Then he worked as a street vendor selling "chicharrones" (pork cracklings) three days a week.  He also started selling ponchos, bedspreads and dish sets.  He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as home products, since the Christmas season is near and this is when demand increases.  His dream is to finish paying for his house so his children will always have a place to live.

loans.use: To buy home products to sell.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Originally from the Prey Chhor district, Huon is now 61 years old. She has struggled to make her living as a farmer for more than 20 years. She has two dependent children. Her daughter works in a garment factory and her other child works in a rice field with her. She earns less than five U.S. dollars per day and saves around three U.S. dollars per day for her current business. 

This is Huon’s first loan with VisionFund. She will use the entire loan to buy rice seeds for her farm and buy a plot of farming land. This loan will enable her to increase her farming and make more rice so as to generate more income to build savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farm and buy a plot of farming land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana es socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, vive por la parroquia Paccha, lugar que se encuentra rodeada de exuberante naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales muchos salen diariamente a laborar en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones des padres.

La Señora. Ana tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera y ha concebido un hijo quien es mayor de edad y trabaja para sus gastos personales. La casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Ella labora en la atención de un bar en una escuela, actividad en la que se encuentra hace 30 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes medio día. En su casa cría pollos, cuyes.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su cuñada. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra colas, jugos, bocadillos, papas fritas, etc. para su bar.

Su meta es tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the village bank Divino Niño Jesús. She lives in the parish of Paccha, a place surrounded by abundant nature. The people work in agriculture, raise animals, and many go to the city of Cuenca every day to work. They maintain the culture and traditions of their parents.

Ana, 56, is single and has one grown son. She works to cover her own costs of living. She owns her house.

She has worked at the snack bar at a school for 30 years. She works half days from Monday to Friday. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs at home.

This is her first loan with the village bank, which she was invited to join by her sister-in-law. She will use the money to buy sodas, juices, snacks, french fries, etc for the snack bar.

Her goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, snacks, french fries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sodas, juices and gatorade.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 57 years old and lives in Looc, Maria, Siquijor. She is married with three adult-age children.

Lorna sells Ready- to-Wear products (clothing) and displays them during market day in her town. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 for working capitalization of her existing business. 

Lorna has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Lorna hopes to sustain her business and be able to purchase more stock to display.

loans.use: To buy RTW (ready to wear) clothing to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 40-year-old married man with four children aged sixteen, nine, seven and five, of whom three attend different schools. He is a farmer who specializes in the growing of passion fruits and he works six days a week and six hours a day; he has been a farmer since 2009. He was motivated by the profitability of the business.

Richard hopes to use the loan to boost his business by buying more passion fruits to sell. He sells his products to fellow traders. His hopes and dreams are to construct a bigger house than the one he now has. He, however, faces a challenge of unfavourable weather conditions such as drought and price fluctuations, which affect his business. He is described as an honest and hard-working man in business and appreciates lenders for the services offered.

loans.use: to buy passion fruits to sell

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: Nuru is 27 years old, single and blessed with two children. She has been in the tea nursery and dairy farming business for 2 years. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to purchase fertilizers for her tea nursery and dairy feeds and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to educate her children as well as repay her loan. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her farming business, make more income and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her tea nursery and dairy feeds and hopes this will enable her to get more farm produce for sell and make more income to educate her children.

loans.name: Gelmy Guadalupe

texts.en:
Glemy Sanchez and her two daughters lived through some very difficult times after her husband\\\'s passing, especially because he was the sole supporter of the family. In this situation she had to be brave and strong in order to provide for her family, and to do so, she decided to start a small business selling chickens with the help of a starter loan. Even so, the income she generated was not enough to cover the basic necessities of her family, so she decided to expand her business to sell corner store items and soft drinks. She now requires a loan of $925 to stock her inventory and henceforth increase her sales.

Please help Glemy and her family. They were able to overcome difficult times but now they need your support to continue on. With your help they will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Glemy S. y sus dos hijas vivieron momentos sumamente complicados tras el fallecimiento de su esposo, quien era el único sostén de la familia, ante ésta situación ella tuvo que adoptar valor y fortaleza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Por todo ello Glemy decidió emprender, con ayuda de un préstamo, un negocio de venta de pollos, con éstos ingresos aún no alcanzaba a cubrir las necesidades básicas, por lo que decidió también ofrecer abarrotes y refrescos. Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo de $925.00 DLLS, para poder comprar más mercancía y así incrementar sus ventas.

Ayuda a Glemy y su familia, ellas pudieron vencer difíciles momentos, ahora ellas te necesitan para continuar, sólo con tu apoyo lo lograrán.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a 65 year old  mother of four.  She operates  a very unusual business: selling very expensive specialized woven  men's clothes that are worn on  important festive occasions.  Ekua has built up a large client base over many years.  The market for these clothes is very promising especially with the country's golden jubilee in full swing through 2007.  She intends to use the proceeds from the KIVA loan to increase her inventory of material and supplies.

loans.use: Increase material and supplies inventory

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella A. has worked on her shop for years. She said that LAPO has lifted her up from the grip of poverty. She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with three children and hopes to get the above loan for business expansion.

loans.use:
To buy more material for soda
making

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
I have run a grocery store for more than 15 years. This store is my family's source of income and my wife, one of our children and I work in it. We hope to expand our business and buy a refrigerator so that we can sell meat. We are asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to by a refrigerator.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 15 años en el negocio de venta de abarrotes. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia en el trabajamos mi esposo y un hijo queremos agrandar mas el negocio y comprar un refrigerador para la venta de carne. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la compra de un refrigerador.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Lisbeth Rosa

texts.es:
Lisbeth is 20 years old and is known as a spunky and enthusiastic girl with hopes of being very successful in life. Coming from a humble family but being a very hard worker, she decided to become independent at the age of 16 and since then has been selling products from a mobile stand. She begins work at 6:00 in the morning and finishes at 9:00 at night every day of the week with the purpose of covering all of her own expenses.

Her goal is to increase the variety of her products to generate more income to be able to open up a local shop in the future. This way she would be able to continue covering her college expenses. With your generous help, Lisbeth will be able to meet her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Lisbeth tien 20 años de edad y se caracteriza por ser una joven luchadora, entusiasta e impetuosa con muchos deseos de triunfar en la vida, proviene de una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora, decidió independizarse a la edad de 16 años y desde entonces se dedicó a la venta de mercerías en forma ambulatoria. Inicia este trabajo a las 6:00 de la mañana y culmina a las 9:00 de la noche todos los días de la semana con el propósito de cubrir todos y cada uno de sus gastos personales. Su deseo es ampliar y aumentar la variedad de productos para generar mayores ingresos económicos y poder abrir en un futuro no muy lejano una tienda de distribución de productos al por mayor; de esta manera podrá seguir cubriendo los gastos que le generan sus estudios superiores. Con tu ayuda generosa Lisbeth podrá cumplir su propósito

loans.use: Lisbeth wants to use her loan to increase the variety of her products

loans.name: Tahir

texts.ru:
Tahir H. was born in 1955 and has 4 children. He is a displaced person from the Nagorno Karabakh region. Currently he is living in Agsu. A difficult life forced him to think about starting a business to bring some profits to his family. Tahir decided to sell clothing. He turned to Normicro for a loan to start his business. He is hoping for a positive future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Гусейнов Тахир 1955 года рождения. Имеет четверых детей. Вынужденный переселенец из Нагорного Карабаха Азербайджанской Республики. Сейчас проживает в городе Ахсу. Трудная жизнь заставил его думать о бизнесе, чтобы принести немножко прибыл в семью. Тахир решил торговать одеждой. Для этого ему нужны были деньги и он обратился в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Этот человек надеятся на хорощий исход своей жизни.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Savaliga

texts.en:
Savaliga is a lady of 42 years who is single, but she’s the key person in her family providing for family expenses and needs. She is one of the longest-involved members of the program, because she has paid back six loans. She is honest in paying her weekly repayments.

She applied for this loan in order to buy prizes for her bingo business and the rest will pay for remaking her family bathroom and toilet in the European style. She said that this program provides a lot for running her business. Without the program, she could not make it, and she’s thankful for the loans and appreciates the help very much.

loans.use: To buy the prizes for her bingo hall business and also for home improvements

loans.name: Francisco Gerardo

texts.es:
Francisco Gerardo is a man who has known how to obtain benefits from his own business and move ahead in spite of not having a family to fight for. Time ago he worked in a bookstore and there he learned how to administer a bookstore. A year ago he opened his own business and thanks to his effort and will to move ahead as well as to offer good books, he is now recognized by his community.

Nevertheless, during this period of time people start to buy more books and therefore Francisco is requesting a loan of $925 to be repaid in 6 months, and with this money he will buy more books in order to offer more variety. He also wishes to redesign his bookstore to be more competitive. With your support Francisco will be able to improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco Gerardo es un hombre que a pesar de no tener una familia por quien luchar, ah sabido obtener beneficios de poner su propio negocio y a podido salir adelante. Hace tiempo trabajó en una librería, y fue ahí donde aprendió todo lo necesario para poder administrar una librería. Hace un año que comenzó con este negocio y gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas por salir adelante, además de proveer buenos libros a podido establecerse entre su comunidad.

Sin embargo en estas fechas la gente comienza a comprar más libros. es por eso que Francisco está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Francisco podrá comprar más libros para poder tener surtido. Además de poder remodelar un poco su librería para poder tener mayor presencia en el mercado. Con tu ayuda Francisco podrá salir adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase more and varied books to be more competitive.

loans.name: Epimako

texts.en: Epimako M., a 65-year-old resident of Mayangayanga in the Kayunga district, is a businessman dealing in used clothes locally referred to as ‘mivumba,’ such as shirts, trousers, shorts, jackets and coats, for boys and men. He buys them every Monday from Kampala, the capital city, and sells them to his customers in the daily markets all around his neighborhood, using his motorcycle as transport. He is married with 15 children and also looks after three of his grandchildren. He has been our client for one-and-a-half years, and the loans have helped him with buying more clothes and increasing the volume of his sales, enabling him to pay school fees and save.

loans.use: Buy more shirts, trousers, shorts, jackets and coats to sell

loans.name: Amavi Mawuéna

texts.fr:
Amavi Mawuena A. is married and the mother of four. She was born on March 25, 1978, in Notsè, a city located 100 km from Lomé. She has been in the business of selling shoes and bags (purses, totes, etc.) since 2005 in the Adawlato marketplace where she displays them for sale. In the beginning, she only sold bags for women. But she noticed that her customers not only wanted bags but also shoes. She therefore decided to include commerce in shoes, which she started by using her first loan of 500,000 francs CFA. Very quickly, she sold out before her loan was due because of the vitality of her business. At present, she is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA for 50 pairs of women's shoes and 5 dozen bags. The loan will increase her income in order to cover family expenses better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Mme A. Amavi Mawuena mariée et mère de 4 enfants, est née le 25 Mars 1978 à Notsè une ville située à 100 km de Lomé. Elle exerce son activité de vente de chaussures et des sacs de sortie depuis 2005 au marché d’Adawlato et les dispose en étalage. Au départ, elle ne vendait que des sacs de sortie pour dame. Mais elle a constaté que sa clientèle en plus des sacs sollicitait des chaussures. Elle a décidé alors d’associer le commerce des chaussures qu’elle a commencé avec son premier crédit de 500.000FCFA. Très rapidement, elle a soldé avant l’échéance en raison de la vitalité de son activité. Actuellement, elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000FCFA pour 50 paires de chaussures de femmes et 5 douzaines de sacs de sortie et accroître son revenu pour pouvoir mieux supporter les charges familiale

loans.use: To sell shoes and bags

loans.name: Laura Senita

texts.es:
Laura belongs to the communal bank Vecinas Unidas (United Neighbors), located at Jr. Ucayali No. 875, in the Callería District in the region of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and is the mother of 3 young children. Her husband is a professor. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles from the Manuela Ramos organization she decided to invest in selling beauty products.

Currently she has a business selling beauty products and making little towels. She wakes up at 7AM. in order to prepare breakfast for her children and husband and works selling her beauty products and making the towels until 8PM.

With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will by 10 meters of cloth of different colors, silk lace, ribbons, threads, creams, perfumes, talc, cologne, deodorants, etc.

Laura is very happy, her business grows every day and now she can buy many things that she has so wanted. Her family is happy for her and very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organization for the support of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Laura pertenece al Banco Comunal Vecinas Unidas, ubicado en el Jr Ucayali No 875, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad, su esposo es profesor. Laura con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de productos de belleza. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de productos de bellaza y de confección de toallitas, se levanta a las 7.00 a.m. Para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo y de se dedica a la venta de sus productos de belleza y a la confección de sus toallitas hasta las 8 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual Será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 10 metros de tela de colores, blondas, cintas, hilos, cremas, perfumes, talcos, colonias, desodorantes, etc. Laura esta muy alegre, su negocio crece cada día, ahora puede comprarse muchas cosas que tanto quería, su familia esta feliz por ella, y esta muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo dado para su negocio.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: José

texts.es:
I recently bought my house but it only has 2 rooms and I need to build another with wood to add a living room so that we won't be so squeezed. I'm applying for a US$500 loans to buy materials to build a new room.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace poco mese adquirí mi casa pero solo tiene 2 cuartos y necesito construir otro mas de madera para poner la sala y así no estar tan ajustados en la casa. Solicito un préstamo de $ 500.00 Dlls. Para la comprar de material para la construcción de un cuarto de madera.

loans.use: Add room on front of house.

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.en:
Ismatullo R. is 51 years old. He’s married, and he and his wife have raised 5 children together. Ismatullo is a farmer. Mainly, he grows crops, such as wheat and rice. Having worked the land for ten years, Ismatullo has gained rich experience. Each year, he yield enough for his family and for sales. His business is his main source of income and generating a stable income requires considerable funding.

Thus, now Ismatullo needs to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds for the harvest and for improving production, thereby increasing the quality of his yield and his earnings at the time of sale. For this purpose he’s asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750 USD). The loan will be repaid in 9 months. After gathering his yield, as usual, he wants to sell them to the local inhabitants for lower prices than in the market. Ismatullo thanks all who are supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch S., 53, is a widowed wedding decorator. She also sells Cambodian noodles. She has been operating her business for eighteen years and earns about $3.50 per day. She has four children, all of whom are young. Two of her children work in Phnom Penh; one is studying at the university and one other is studying to be decorator.

To expand her business, S. is asking a loan to purchase more decorative materials to upgrade her existing materials.

loans.use: To purchase more decorative materials for her business

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Mrs. OU M. is a pig breeder in Tbeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Aside from breeding pigs, Mrs. OU M. buys and sells baskets. Her husband, Mr. Sareth Koe, sells traditional Cambodian medicines. They have two children who are attending school. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. OU M. wants to start cultivating rice. She is now requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to to purchase a piece of land to grow the rice. Mrs. OU M. had previously obtained a loan to start her husband's business and she has paid it back in full. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings in order to to purchase a piece of land to grow rice.

loans.name: Talat

texts.en: M. Talat is a very responsible and hard working woman. She is married and has 4 adorable children. Several years ago Maria decided to start her own business. She was working in a garment factory near her home and knew a lot about making clothing, so with some savings she opened a small seamstress shop in her house. In time, she gained customers and a good reputation for her work. Talat’s children are all studying at school and the next year two of her sons are planning to enter university and need tuition. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a loan of 740 USD that will be invested in buying fabrics to increase her production and cover her customers' demands. She commits to return the original amount in 12 months. Help this family improve their quality of life by contributing to the growth of Talat’s business. They sincerely thank you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing dresses.

loans.name: Concepcion Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora  Concepcion M., tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos cuyas edades son de 10, 9, 6 y 3 años respectivamente, todos estudian la primaria en colegio publico, su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia en la venta de productos plasticos, aportando de esta manera al hogar. Su proposito es poder seguir trabajando en su pequeña pulperia, su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida al mimso tiempo ver que su negocio esta creciendo, su sueño es poder ver realizados a sus hijos como profesionales, su mayor deseo es poder darles condiciones de via a sus hijos, ya que la infraestructura actual de su casa es mala, La actividad eocnomica de Doña Concepcion es una puleria donde ofrece productos de uso y consumo para el hogar, teneindo su negocito en su casa de habitacion, vendiendo tambien productos plasticos, en su negocio tiene 10 años de tenerlo dando inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y una manera de aportar a los gastos del hogar, con el credito pretende invertor mas su pulperia a fin de poder tener un regular inventario y satisfacer su demanda,
texts.en:
Concepción M. is 34 years old, married, and has four children who are 10, 9, 6 and 3 years old respectively. All are in primary grades in public school, and her husband is self-employed selling plastic products to support the household. Her goal is to continue working in her small general store, and her wish is to improve their standard of living while at the same time seeing growth in her business. Her dream is to see her children become successful professionals, and her greatest desire is to give them a better living environment given that the infrastructure of her home is in bad shape. Concepción’s business is a small general store where she offers household products, having installed the business in her own home. She also sells plastic products, and has been in business for ten years having started as an alternative to being unemployed and as a way to help support the family. With the loan, she intends to invest more into her store with the goal of attaining a stable inventory and satisfy her customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
Amil P. is 22 years old. He's a very optimistic guy who is full of energy! He owns a small shop in the little village where he was born. He lives with his parents, who are on pension now.

Amil started his business in 2005, as soon as he finished high school. His father supported him financially in starting up his business. The store now provides a stable monthly income but just enough to cover basic family needs and not to expand the business. Amil has applied for a loan of $1000 to purchase more inventory for his shop to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for his shop.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Mr. Phea C. is a villager in Preak Samroung village in Kandal Province. He is a fisherman who can catch a small amount of fish because he has insufficient fishing tools. 

In order to improve this business, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat motor to use with his boat. In addition, he would use the rest of the money to purchase fishnets for his fishing. 

His wife, Mrs. Phann Sao Ry, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice. Mr. Phea C. is 46 years old and the father of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a boat motor and purchase fishnets for his fishing.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan P. lives in Kna Village in Kampong Cham Province, where she breeds ducks. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand and is therefore requesting a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. She hopes to thereby increase her income and improve the family living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Yan Korn, presented on the left in the photo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice, and they have three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is yet too young to study.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Ul

texts.en:
Ul C. is 60 years old and lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a widow and earns a living raising pigs in a stall behind her house. She sells the pigs for slaughter six months after she begins raising them. 

She can raise litters twice per year and has been raising pigs more than 24 years. She learned the skill from her grandfather. For additional income, she also sells fish. 

She currently has four children; three of them are married and the other one is single. Two of her children are employed: one is a fish seller and other one is a fisherman. In order to make the business successful, C. has applied for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and some fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to raise and some fish to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco A. B. tiene la edad de  51 años, habita en el reparto Juan Ramón Padilla junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como cocinera para poder apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo una hija de 20 años que actualmente estudia su ultimo año de secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es poder seguir dándole estudio a su hija para que ella pueda ser una profesional.  Don Francisco es agricultor desde hace veinte años, el inicio a cultivar sus tierras por medio de cooperativa y ahora con los beneficios que Afodenic le a brindado a logrado mejorar y establecer mas cultivo. Con este préstamo es para dar mantenimiento en fertilización al cultivo de piña para tener una buena producción
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. B. is 51 years old and lives in the division of Juan Ramón Padilla with his wife, who works as a cook to help him with the household expenses. They care for their 20-year-old daughter who is currently in her final year of secondary school. The family plans are to continue her studies so she can become a professional. Francisco has been a farmer for 20 years. He began cultivating his fields through a co-op, and now with the support of Afodenic he has improved and established more crops. With this loan, he will fertilize his pineapple crop to improve productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs to improve pineapple crop

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 45 years old and the mother of three children. The children are currently in school. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand-new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Regina. She would like to use her loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a stall to sell her goods in. She is a member of the group called Winners. Members agree to stand as guarantees for each other as social collateral to access and repay loans.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Afras

texts.en: This is Afras E.. He is 29 years old and lives in Imishli city, where he runs a retail shop to support his family. In his shop, Afras sells spare parts for many different types of foreign cars. He has worked in this business for the last two years. He hopes to increase his income and get married this year. To do this, he needs to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to better meet the needs of his customers. The loan will be repaid within 15 months. Afras is happy to be able to apply for this loan and thanks everyone for their trust. He promises to be precise in making loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Marlene del Socorro R. Pérez tiene la edad de 49 años,  habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla , junto a su esposo , él cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tienen a su cargo una hija de 15 años que actualmente estudia , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su hija para que sea una profesional en el futuro , desde hace seis años doña Marlene trabaja como agricultura , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento , el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para obtener una mejor cosecha y poder vender mejor en el mercado.
texts.en:
Marlene del Socorro R. Pérez is 49 years old, and she lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood of Managua with her husband. He also works to help her cover their household expenses, since they must look after their 15-year-old daughter, who is currently a student. Marlene's plans for her family are to improve their living conditions and to support her daughter so that she may become a professional in the future. Since the age of 6, Marlene has worked in farming. The main difficulty in her work has always been a lack of funding. She will invest her loan in the purchase of raw materials and fertilizers so that she can obtain a better harvest, allowing her to sell more when she goes to market.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos agricolas para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Lola es casada, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Lola viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras, frutas, abarrotes y de las ferias compra quesos, ajo, gallinas productos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lola necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ajo, quesos.
Los sueños de Lola son mejorar su negocio, comprar un puesto en el mercado en donde venda comida.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Golondrinas Community Bank.

Lola is married, 23 years old and has two children. Lola travels to different markets in the region where she sells vegetables, fruits, groceries and buys cheese, garlic, and rooster products that she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Lola needs a loan of 2100 soles ($700 USD), money that will be invested in the purchase of garlic and cheeses.

Lola’s dreams are to improve her business and buy a stand in the market to sell food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase garlic, cheese

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She sells medicine to make a living. She is hoping for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Rodney

texts.en:
Rodney is a native Hawaiian, and avid ukulele player, who struggled to find his niche in California after being laid off. Deciding that he had to be passionate about his next career choice, Rodney began teaching the ukulele out of his condo. Ukelele Jams provides instruction on ukulele music theory and strumming for students of all ages. The business gives Rodney a chance to do what he loves for a living, while raising awareness about Hawaiian culture.

A $2,000 loan helps Rodney grow his business by establishing a commercial location and furnishing it with tables, chairs, filing cabinets, a computer and other teaching materials.

Visit http://www.ukulelejams.com/

Watch a video of Rodney playing the ukelele: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ujkg0Q23Uqs&feature=channel_page

loans.use: Furnishing classroom space

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. sells footwear for both men and women. Adwoa hawks to sell her goods and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Adwoa is 31 years old, married and has two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a trader. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Adwoa wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Opoku

texts.en:
Opoku has been selling soft drinks in bulk for three years now. He sells soft drinks like Coca Cola, Pepsi and others. He has suppliers from Kumasi who supply him directly without any middlemen. His only problem has to do with funds.

Opoku is 40 years old, married and the father of three children. Currently, all his children are in school. Opoku is a very hardworking young man who strives to provide for his family. He is requesting a loan to buy assorted drinks to upgrade his business. He dreams to build his own house from the business proceeds and also save some money to take care of the children in school.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks in bulk

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia B. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 48 years old. Gaudencia is engaged and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gaudencia owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gaudencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Gaudencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gaudencia successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Gaudencia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Gaudencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer M. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. He is 57 years old. Elmer is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Elmer owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elmer is just starting this business.

In 2009, Elmer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmer is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Elmer from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children and to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tauveve

texts.en: Tauveve S. (0) is a 25-year-old woman living in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has one infant child. Tauveve owns and operates a business running a bakery, baking and selling cakes in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 250 WST a month. In 2008, Tauveve joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment. Tauveve is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 2nd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Resty's Group

texts.en: N. Resty is the leader of her group in Lugazi. She is a hard working and devoted lady with a retail shop business that she has had for 5 years. She is a mother of 5 children who are all in school as she cares for 2 dependants. She opened up her shop using savings from agriculture and only joined her lending group to increase on the capital. Resty has a dream of expanding her shop to include more products that will bring in more income as well as buying a commercial plot in the middle of her trading centre. She currently needs a loan to help with restocking her retail shop with more goods for increased profitability.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Nak

texts.en: Mrs. Nak O. is a villager in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Doeu Tin, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Nak O. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field.

loans.name: Dina Ines

texts.es:
La señora DINA INES C. D. C., tiene 64 años, vive en el distrito D. Trujillo, provincia D. Trujillo , departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL PROGRESO.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6To D. primaria ya que desD. pequeña ella se tuvo que dedicara al campo.
Ella vivió hasta los 13 años en Otuzco y sus padres se preocuparon mas por enseñarle los que haceres del campo, el cuidado D. los animales y los que haceres domésticos que por darle educación.
La socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, todos mayores, quienes la apoyan y la cuidan cuando se enferma.
DINA se dedica a la compra y venta D. vino al por mayor que trae D. la cuidad D. Casca y los venD. para eventos especiales como: Matrimonios, Bautizos, Aniversarios, Cumpleaños, Promociones, etc.
También venD. botellas D. vino al por mayor y menor en su domicilio.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. galones  D. vino al por mayor para luego distribuirlo en Trujillo.
EL crédito D. 1,500 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra D. mas galones D. vino y botellas para envasar.
La empresaria sueña con aumentar sus ventas, comprar andamios y poder exhibir los vinos en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dina Ines C. D. C. is 64 years old, lives in the Trujillo district in the province of Trujillo in the Libertad department of Peru. She belongs to the Mujeres al Progreso Communal Bank. Dina only studied through 6th graD., because ever since she was young, she has had to work on a farm. Until she was 13 years old, she lived in Otuzco, and her parents spent more time teaching her the chores of the farm, like caring for the animals and domestic chores, than they did on her education. She is married with five grown-up children who help her and take care of her when she gets sick. Dina makes her living by buying bottles of alcohol wholesale and selling them retail in her home. She spent her first loan of 300 soles on gallons of wholesale alcohol for distribution in Trujillo. This new loan, of 1,500 soles, will go towards the purchase of more gallons of alcohol and bottles. She dreams of increasing her sales and buying scaffolding so she can sell her alcohol out of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale liquor.  Purchase of bottles for bottling liquor.

loans.name: Grolia

texts.en:
Grolia M. is 31 years old, married with three children of her own, and also takes care of six dependents aged between 2 and 22. This large family of eleven, all live together in Ngoma district, Kibungo Province, where her pharmacy is located as well.

Grolia has a proven track record as an entrepreneur. She has ten years of experience in the business of selling animal medicines and veterinary services and employs one person from her community. She is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to grow her business by purchasing more supplies and equipment. This will allow her to serve more customers which will (hopefully) allow her to earn more profit.

With any additional profit she earns from this strategy, Grolia plans to reinvest in her business as well as save money and build a more secure future for her large family.

loans.use: To purchase more medical supplies and equipment

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.en: Committee Barrio Alegre was formed on July 16, 2008. The women’s committee began as an initiative by Zulli G. who brought together 16 women. They are currently on their fourth cycle. All team members are very happy with the partnership and work in solidarity and support each other. The average credit drawn by each member is 593,000 Gs. Most women use their loans to improve their businesses in selling clothes, food (dried fruits, rice, sugar, noodles, milk), books, baked goods, cleaning supplies, fabric and dress-making patterns. The group is very active and have achieved a lot working together.

loans.use: Purchased merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of rice and beans for catering.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.fr: K. Josiane est née le 26 Avril 1976 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à DEDEGBE Eric, un enseignant, Josiane est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Josiane a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses deux enfants. La famille réside à Hèvié à Abomey Calavi (non loin de Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin). C’est depuis 4 ans que Josiane vit dans ce quartier. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Josiane a fréquenté l’école jusqu’à l’université. Mais depuis près de 4 ans, Josiane gère un télécentre où elle fait la photocopie et vend également des glaces. Josiane sollicite ce premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin de s’approvisionner en photocopieur, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Josiane ambitionne ouvrir plus tard un cyber centre dans la ville de Cotonou.
texts.en:
Josiane K. was born on 26 April 1976 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Eric DEDEGBE, a teacher, and is the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. Josiane also takes care of one other child. The family has been living in Hèvié in Aborney Calavi (not very far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin) for the last four years. The couple provide together for the family. Josiane attended school all the way to university level. For the last four years, she has been the manager of a center where people have access to telephones and internet. She also provides photocopies as well as selling ice cream. She is asking for this first loan from Alidé in order to purchase a photocopier, in order to better serve her clients. Josiane hopes to one day open a cyber center in Cotonou.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Katty Kerlith

texts.es:
Katty es una socia muy responsable, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 30 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente. Katty forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Flores”, desde hace un año, donde siempre se ha caracterizado por su respeto hacia las demás socias.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado para la implementación de su bodega.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 700 soles, que será invertido en la compra de panetones, leche azúcar y chocolate por fiestas navideñas. La meta de Katty es tener una tienda más grande y más implementada y dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Katty is a very responsible member. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is 30 years old and mother of two children, both young. She sells basic supplies from her store which is located in her home. Her husband, who is an independent worker, helps her. For the past year, Katty has been part of the “Las Flores” (The Flowers) communal bank. She is always very respectful towards the other members. The first loan she received was for 300 Soles which she used to start up her store. She is now in need of a loan of 700 Soles to be used to buy “panetones” (cake with raisins and fruit), milk, sugar and chocolate for the Christmas festivities. Katty’s goal is to have a bigger, more established store and to give a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy “panetones” (cake with raisins and fruit), milk, sugar and chocolate

loans.name: Paulita

texts.es:
La Sra. Paulita Vive en el Barrio Monte Alto su actividad principal  es la venta de comida y su segunda actividad es la venta de cosméticos, su esposo es chofer asalariado el le ayuda con los gastos de la familia, tienen tres hijos en edad escolar, actualmente su casa esta en construcción y su lote lo están terminando de cancelar, trabajan duro  para tener su propia casa y poder criar a sus hijos y cumplir asi uno de sus sueños el de tener una casa propia.

La Sra. Paulita es una persona muy responsable, dinamica y muy trabajadora.

El destino de su crédito solicitado fue para la compra de abarrotes(fideo, arroz, aceite, etc)por fin de año, la señora esta agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Paulita lives in the Monte Alto neighborhood. Her main line of work is the sale of groceries and her secondary line of work is cosmetics sales. Her husband is a salaried driver and he helps her pay for household expenses. They have three, school-age children. Their house is currently under construction and they are still paying off their lot. They work hard to have a proper home and to raise their children and to see their dream of having their own home come true. Paulita is a very responsible, dynamic and hard-working person. She will use these funds to buy groceries (pasta, rice, cooking oil, etc.) for the end of year. She is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in her by granting her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Alberto Perez

texts.es:
El Señor Alberto Pérez Sánchez, Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.
 El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cerámica y cemento para su cuarto de habitación, por lo que anteriormente estaba solo embaldosada.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alberto Pérez Sánchez works as a janitor in the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute. He is married and has a son in his care who is school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. Thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL he has been able to take out 3 loans over this time, which were used to improve the home that he lives in. He is an excellent client. The loan he now requests will be used to buy construction materials such as ceramic tile and cement for a room in his house, because previously the floor was covered only in bare concrete. He takes this loan with the objective of providing better security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Wilson Gerardo

texts.es:
Wilson Gerardo V. B., tiene la edad de 26 años, está soltero, y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para cría.Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don wilson trabaja con el ganado desde hace varios años. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Wilson Gerardo V. B., 26, is single. He has no children and lives with his parents. He needs a loan to buy cattle. The idea is to raise cattle. He wants to provide proper care so that the cattle will command the best possible sale price when they are sold. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms offered. Wilson has raised cattle for many years. He hopes to provide his family with better living conditions and greater economic stability in the future as well as to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, rice and salt in bulk to sell to her customers

loans.name: Santa Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Santa Kumari N. is a farmer in the village of Dolchoki. She owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables. Mostly she grows seasonal vegetables in her land, and she sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily. She uses her income in fulfilling the needs of her family. Now Mrs. N. is requesting a loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her farming. 

Mrs. N. lives with her husband and four children. Her husband Mr. Ram Bahadur N. is a carpenter. She has three sons and one daughter. Her sons are studying in grade 12, 10 and 8, respectively, and her daughter is in grade 5.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yao Agbéviadé

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un père de famille, il a 2 enfants, afin de subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il s’est lancée dans les travaux d’imprimerie, il a ouvert à cet effet sa propre imprimerie qu’il appelle « IMPRIMERIE PREMICES », il a en ce moment des commandes qu’il doit exécuter, pour y parvenir il doit se réapprovisionner en papiers, c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers papiers d’imprimerie.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a family man who has two children. In order to cover his family's expenses he launched a printing business. In this context, he opened his own printing works which he has named "IMPRIMERIE PREMICES". At present he has orders to execute and in order to do this he needs to get fresh supplies of paper. For this reason he is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy various types of printing paper.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paper

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 31-year-old housewife and mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Sarah's husband Fareez is a school bus driver and, in the evening, a taxi driver, so Sarah established her own business to help her husband support the big family they share together.

Last year Sarah used the couple's savings to buy a number of hens, feed and a coop. The hens were bought for the purpose of producing and selling eggs and chicks. For the past year the farm has been making good money and attracting a good number of customers, which has helped the couple afford life expenses.  Sarah is thinking of expanding the farm and buying more hens to increase production, so she came to FATEN to take a loan.

Sarah's husband Fareez stands next to the hens' coop in the picture as Sarah is a conservative woman who doesn't want her picture published online.

loans.use: To buy more hens for her farm

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Sarantuya S. is a 38-year-old widow who lives with her parents in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic housing tent) in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family have been living together in their current home for 30 years. Sarantuya operates a cafe in her town. From 2008 to 2010, she worked as a cook in a local restaurant. Using her experience, she opened her own cafe in early 2010 and has steadily expanded her business over the first months of operation. Sarantuya is the head cook at the cafe, but her entire family helps out. She opened her cafe with capital of 200,000 MNT and in a short time it has increased to a level exceeding 300,000 MNT. Sarantuya hopes to continue her early success and expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking woman and attributes her success to her good communication skills. Her business is her family's main source of income and it has allowed her to improve their quality of life. Sarantuya is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase supplies for her cafe.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Metzie

texts.en:
Metzie A. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has five school-aged children.

Metzie owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years now.

In 2009, Metzie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Metzie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira P. P. tiene 28 años de edad y vive con sus padres y 2 hijos, Cristian de 9 años y Sisa de 3 años. Ellos viven en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Rosa es una socia de de la ventanilla rural Mushuc Yuyai (Nuevo Pensamiento), que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda.  Son 12 socios en total, jóvenes, que están estudiando y trabajando en la agricultura al mismo tiempo.

Rosa trabaja en el campo agrícola y en la pecuaria, para un mejor rendimiento económico. Siembra papas, habas, cebada, y tiene vacas de leche que le permiten de hacer queso. Hace las ventas y compras en Guaranda. 

Solicita el crédito para mejorar su rendimiento económico, comprar semillas para el campo y lo que las vacas necesitan. Su sueño es tener una empresa y mejorar con el apoyo de la Cooperativa San José. Su familia la apoya siempre a seguir adelante.

Esta trabajando desde muy pequeña para mejorar la situación económica y la vida de su familia. Le gustan las fiestas como el carnaval de Guaranda, que es una actividad social importante para la comunidad y su cultura indígena.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira P. P. is 28 years old and lives with her parents and her two children, Cristian (age 9) and Sisa (age 3). They live in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Mushuc Yuyai” (New Idea), which is located 30 minutes from Guaranda. There are twelve members in total, all of whom are young and are studying and working in agriculture at the same time.

Rosa engages in farming and raising livestock in order to improve her financial situation. She grows potatoes, beans, and barley. Rosa also has dairy cows, which allows her to make cheese. She buys and sells her products in Guaranda.

Rosa is requesting a loan to improve her financial situation. She will buy seeds for her field and also cows that she needs. Her dream is to have a business and continue improving with the support of Cooperativa San José. The help of her family always keeps her moving forward.

From a very young age, Rosa has worked to improve her financial condition and the life of her family. She enjoys festivities such as Carnival in Guaranda, which is an important social event for the community and its indigenous culture.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & cows

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Alberto C., de 40 años de edad, es macatero desde hace más de 10 años. Se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos para el hogar tales como: electrodomésticos, prendas de vestir, calzados, etc. venta que lo realiza a cuotas.
El Sr. Alberto posee una camioneta en el cual realiza su trabajo diario, a la fecha posee  230 clientes por las zonas de Jhugua Ñaro, Itaugua, Las Piedras, Aveiro, etc., todas compañías y ciudades aledañas a la ciudad de Itá de donde el Sr. Alberto es oriundo.
Además se dedica a la  venta de un conocido refresco  desde hace mas de 15 años, actividad con el cual comenzó su comercio. Es por ello que solicita el crédito para la construcción de su pequeña fábrica  en su domicilio ya que adquirió una máquina para fabricar por cuenta propia con lo cual logrará producir mayor cantidad y por ende obtendrá mayores ganancias.
El Sr. Alberto es una persona muy sacrificada que día a día va buscando la forma de superarse y mejorar su bienestar y el de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Alberto C., age 40, has been a rural street vendor for over 10 years. He buys and sells such products as home appliances, clothing, footwear, etc. He accepts monthly payments for those goods. Mr. C. has a pick-up truck out of which he works daily. To date, he has 230 customers in the Jhugua Ñaro, Itaugua, Las Piedras, and Aveiro regions, as well as all the other communities and cities near Itá, Mr. C.'s hometown.

He has also been selling a well-known beverage for over 15 years, which was how he got his business started. He is now requesting a loan in order to build a small factory in his home because he obtained machine for some freelance manufacturing. He will be able to produce more, thus obtaining more profits.

Mr. C. is a very selfless person who is looking for a way to better himself and improve his family's well-being on a daily basis.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel T. is from the city of Banaderos Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Ritchel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ritchel owns and operates a general store, selling candies, shampoo, cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar, bath soap, soap for laundry, etc., in the local community. Ritchel has been in business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Ritchel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritchel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ritchel is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Ritchel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 57 years old. She is a married mother of two children who are ages 17 and 39. Her youngest child is currently attending school.

Rose is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. She has been managing her farm for the last 30 years and on several occasions has employed two or three casual employees. Her main products are coffee, which she sells to the coffee factory; cabbages; milk; carrots, which she sells to middlemen; and fine beans, which she sells to the Homegrown Company.

Her primary challenges have been pests and diseases, the high cost of farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides, and a lack of enough capital for expansion.

Rose has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire another dairy cow, which will increase her income and improve the living standards of her family. In the future, she plans to expand her dairy farming by acquiring four more dairy cows and a bigger and better zero-grazing shed. She also plans to expand her coffee farming.

She is grateful for the assistance offered by Juhudi and hopes to get another loan once she clears this loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Isidora ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, zanahoria y arveja, las cuales los lleva a vender al por mayor en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y aún sigue disfrutando trabajar en el campo, cuidar sus cultivos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Isidora is 45 years old. She is a very unpretentious and hard working woman. She lives in a rented home together with her 4 beloved children, to whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. With a great deal of work Isidora has managed her fields to make them very productive. She cultivates potatoes, carrots, and peas. She sells her harvest in wholesale in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her harvests have granted her an income, enough to support her family, reason for which she expends all of her energy in the business. She has 20 years' experience in the field and even after all this time she still enjoys working the fields, and caring for her plantations. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to expand production. This is her eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has been on time with her loans in the past and she hopes to keep up her record. In her community bank she is a very involved member, always on top of the business and agreements of the group. With the two thousand soles she requests she will purchase fertilizer to improve her harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok M., 49, runs a small business in which she sells incense inside the market. She also buys incense in bulk from her supplier to resell at a profit. To help meet family obligations, her husband works in construction.

Sok M. faces difficulty with transporting her items to sell because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. Therefore, Sok M. has decided to ask a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase a motorcycle which she will use for taking her incense to market and as the family’s means of transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Yhosselin Karla

texts.es: La Sra. Yhosselin Vive en la localidad de el Torno, del departamento de Santa Cruz, es nacida en la localidad, hace 2 año que se dedica a la actividad de licorería, el cual es su ingreso que le permite criar a su pequeño hijo, su es poso se dedica a trabajos eventuales de la albañilería, por falta de recurso vive en la casa de sus padres, el destino del crédito es para la compra de muebles que le faltan para que su negocio funciona mejor es una persona muy joven y trabajadora con muchas ganas de superación, su deseo es de comprarse un lotecito, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Yhosselin lives where she was born in the El Torno area in the department of Santa Cruz. For 2 years she has had a liquor store which is her main source of income and allows her to raise her young son. Her husband works as a mason. Due to their lack of resources they live in her parents' home.

The loan will be used to purchase shelves and counters so her business can run properly. She is young and hardworking with a great desire to succeed. Her dream is to buy a small lot and she is very thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Purchase shelves/counters

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay M., 37, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products.
