Svay is employed at a factory, earning an income of 2.33 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 2.66 USD per day. Svay has to spend 40 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 10 USD on other necessary expenses every month.

Svay is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase a cow to help plow their rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a cow to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Alexei

texts.en:
Alexei is married with a two-year-old daughter. He is a farmer from Velikaya Znamenka. Alexei grows early spring vegetables i.e. radishes, tomatoes, etc. to sell in the markets of his region. He owns two big arch greenhouses, one for seedlings and four smaller ones for tomatoes. Moreover, he also has a tractor which helps him generate additional income in spring when he plows fields for other farmers in his region. Alexei has been growing vegetables for three years. He has already invested 50,000 Grivnyas in this business. He spends about 12,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film every year. 

Alexei is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase polyethylene film and additional seeds for next farming season. He can be characterized as a hard-working businessman with good potential for further business development. Alexei is hoping to generate additional income and eventually construct two more arch greenhouses. He has enough land and has permission to build on it. Alexei’s wife is expecting, which is why he is ready and willing to work extra hard to provide for all the family needs.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film and seeds

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is thirty-two years old.  He lives in the village of Lagunas in the district of Morrope in northern Peru.  He is married and lives along with his wife and their three minor children.  They own the home in which they live.

The family has two main sources of income: Marcelino works in the fields and as a farm hand, assisting in the planting, weeding, maintenance or harvesting of crops, and his wife raises animals in the yard behind their home.  Marcelino is a well-respected laborer and has good contacts in order to maintain consistent work.  He and his wife are also very knowledgable in the proper raising of animals.  Between these two activities, they are able to maintain a relatively stable income stream.

The requested loan will be used to purchase additional animals and feed. The family raises chickens, ducks, guinea pigs, goats, and pigs.  They want to expand their herd and improve the animals' growth rate in order to take advantage of holiday season prices.

This will be Marcelino’s first experience with a financial institution.  He appreciates the opportunity to obtain credit at a lower interest rate from Edpyme Alternativa as a result of the funding from Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals and feed.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del banco comunal De La Amistad II, del Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se desempeña como chofer en una empresa de transporte.
Lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de comida  (almuerzos) que los reparte en  los aserraderos y por las tardes vende los asaditos y Juanes (comida típica de la zona).
Gracias a esta actividad, aporta dinero para los gastos de su hogar, porque el sueldo del esposo no alcanza para solventar todos los gastos.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 soles la señora Margarita comprará 50 tapers  de plástico,  una licuadora, un balde de plástico para su refresco, 50 cucharas, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, ½ caja de aceite y demás insumos para la preparación de comida. 
La señora margarita agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos y las charlas educativas que les imparten las promotoras en cada reunión.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the 'De La Amistad II' community bank which is located in Ucayali department.  She is 40 years old, married and has 2 children.  Her husband works as a driver in a transport company.

Margarita has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for 3 years.  She sells food (lunches) which she delivers to local sawmills and in the afternoon she sells 'asaditos' (barbecued meat) and 'Juanes' (a mixture of chicken pieces, rice, olives, eggs, onion and garlic, wrapped and cooked in a banana leaf).  Both are traditional food of the region.

Thanks to her business, Margarita provides money towards her family's household expenses because her husband's wage doesn't cover all their expenses.

With this loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles, Margarita will buy 50 plastic containers, a blender, a plastic bucket for her soft drinks, 50 spoons, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, half a box of oil and other supplies for preparing her food.

Margarita is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their loans and the educational talks which they give at each community bank meeting.

loans.use: To buy 50 plastic containers, a blender, a plastic bucket for her soft drinks, 50 spoons, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, half a box of oil and other supplies for preparing her food

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic O., 43.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Flaviano O., a maintenance man.  She is the mother of three children, one of whom is already working while two are still studying — one in college and one in high school. 

By the grace of God, Marivic has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college.  This is the dream for most Filipino parents like Marivic, as she herself has been a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Marivic does a little sideline work besides her handwoven bags and scapulars business: she has a trading business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, then sell them piecemeal with a small profit. Products can range from furniture to household appliances, electronic devices, clothing, and other items. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marivic dreams to be able to give her all her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy products to expand inventory

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn S. is a 33-year-old married woman, and she is the village bank president, having been selected by its eighteen members. They are living in Kandal Kraom village in Kandal province. The members of this village bank hope that they will increase their income to support their families and improve their living conditions by using these loans.

Mrs. Horn S. is a farmer who owns a pL. of rice field which she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She doesn’t have enough money to grow her rice, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay farm laborers to cultivate the rice. Her husband, Mr. Chin Channy, 31 years old, is a house builder and can earn a little income to help support his family. 

This couple has three children: Two are attending the local school and the youngest one is only 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and pay farm laborers

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is from the village of Villa M Tejero Liloy Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old. Elsie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns & operates a business making & selling pork products in the local community. Elsie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Elsie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elsie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Yeny

texts.es:
Yeny vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco las personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios. Eliana es técnica en enfermería y trabaja en la clínica EDEN de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. Yeny también se dedica a la venta verduras los días sábados y vende jugos los domingos en el mercado de Tica Tica. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo frutas, verduras y muchas cosas más. Su sueño de la socia es abrir una tienda de abarrotes.   

Yeny pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Yeny lives in the historic city of Cusco, Cusco Department, Perú.  In the city of Cusco, people make their livings with different types of businesses and services.  Yeny is a nursing technician at the EDEN clinic.  She works Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon.  Yeny also makes a living selling vegetables on Saturdays and juice on Sundays at the Tica Tica market.  She needs the loan to purchase supplies like fruits, vegetables and many other things.  Her dream is to open a small grocery store.

Yeny belongs to the “Hijas de María” (Daughters of María) communal bank, a part of the Arariwa Association, Cusco, Perú. The communal bank is in its third year and it has been going very well for all of the members.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, for example fruits, vegetables and many other things.

loans.name: Jovans

texts.en:
Jovans K. lives in the Lubya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  five children, all of whom are in school. Jovans has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Jovans sells her product at the market. Jovans has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to increase her capital.     

The main business challenge for Jovans is seasonality.  Her goal is to earn a good living in the future.   Jovans lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: buying more charcoal

loans.name: Penn

texts.en:
Penn P. S. was born in 1962, she is married to Penn Pius Ndoh, and they are blessed with seven children. Their family lives at Foncha Street, a neighbourhood in Nkwen Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon.

P. has faced some challenges in life. She has been struggling to raise these children with the help of her husband. She faces difficulties providing for their school needs, especially payment of their school fees on time. She has successfully borrowed and repaid loans seven times with GHAPE since 2002. She plans to invest this loan in a provision store which will contain rice, beans, palm oil, groundnut oil, savon, magi, salt, and the sale of firewood. She has been in this for a long time now, and success is her watch word. She believes the business will succeed because she has targeted a period where there will be scarcity of firewood and at that time it will be expensive. The loan will help her community because they will be able to buy firewood and other items in her provision store at affordable prices.

P. will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. Her children’s school needs will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the method of obtaining and paying back the loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy palm oil, groundnut oil, rice, savon, firewood.

loans.name: Jarlene Acupe's Group

texts.en:
Jarlene A. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Jarlene is married and has two school-aged children. Jarlene is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Jarlene A.’s Group".

To make a living, Jarlene owns and operates a hog raising business. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jarlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Jarlene is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


About Group Loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a married woman with seven children. Her oldest child is 19 years old. Rosie makes candies for a living. Her bestseller is yema, which is a sweet concoction made of milk and egg yolks. Rosie sells her candies to schools and around her community. She also grows pineapples and sells the fruits to the market.
Rosie's loan will be used to purchase ingredients such as milk and sugar. Rosie hopes that her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as milk and sugar

loans.name: Rosada Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosada está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Rosa Patricia T. quien se dedica a la venta de  ropa típica desde hace 8 años: Además tiene una pequeña pulpería en la que invertirá el crédito con la compra de granos básicos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Jazmina S. la cual tiene un pequeño taller de artesanía donde produce cuadros y ropa desde hace 20 años además de comercializar también vende de otros artesanos y Juan José M. quien elabora impresos como sobre, tarjetas… etc
texts.en: The three members of the Rosada community bank work hard.  One of them, Rosa Patricia T., has operated a clothing sales business for 8 years.  She also has a small grocery store and she plans to use the loan to buy basic commodities that she will resell.  The other members of the group are Jazmina S., who has operated a business making and selling craft products and clothing for 20 years, and Juan Jose M., who operates a print shop making envelopes, business cards, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz es una madre D. familia D. 46 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en la provincia D. Chepén, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque.

Luz cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por un familiar. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente tiene una mototaxi (unidad móvil con una cabina que sirve para transportar personas). 

La creciente demanda que la bodega D. Luz ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1700 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer bastante trabajadora y D. muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Luz is 46 years old and lives with his family in the Chepén province, a commercial zone located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayaque department.

Luz has a small store in her home, which is staffed by her family.  There they sell different consumable products and groceries to their neighbors and customers.  The business has been received well.  Additionally, she has a moto-taxi (a modified motorcycle with a passenger compartment added).

The growth that the store has experienced has maD. her think that she has to expand it by acquiring more products, so she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,700 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

Luz is a hardworking woman of good character.  The people who know her have great respect for her.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a 51-year-old housewife, who manages her household expenses very well and fulfills her daily routine tasks with a great sense of responsibility. She is married with two sons. Both of them work. Her elder son sells vegetables while the younger one is involved with selling fruits. 
Her husband is a fruit vendor by profession and sells fresh seasonal fruits to his clients. 

Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her husband’s fruit selling business. With this loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell to his clients. He believes in providing his clients with good quality fruits which helps him to retain customers and make better profits. Her husbnad has been operating his business for the past 15 years and Azra is confident that an investment will help him further expand his business and increase his profits. 

Azra is a new loan applicant and this is her first application to Asasah. She is hopeful that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Azra.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Everyone wants a happy family and Marivic, 49, is no exception. Marivic was a high school graduate. At present, she is a wife to Jose, a construction worker, and a loving mother to four children. Two of her children are already working, while two are studying in high school. Their family resides in Pasay City. Aside from her family and business, Marivic also spends time attending weekly Bible fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

In order to make a living, Marivic sells frozen food from house to house in their community in Pasay. She sees this as an effective strategy since it also gives her a way to build relationships with her customers on a more intimate level. She has been doing this by herself for six years now, and earns a monthly net income of Php 9,000.

To help continue the operation of her business, Marivic is requesting a loan for Php13,000 to help her increase her sales. She will use this to add more to her stocks of processed meat such as hotdogs and sweet ham, as well as pork and chicken meat. She admits that the loan will definitely boost her capital and will serve as a step toward business growth. According to her, part of the profits will be used to finance the schooling of her children, so the loan benefits not only the business but also her family.

One struggle Marivic faces is delayed payments by her customers. Some do not pay in full and leave part of it to debt. Marivic frequently worries about the education of her children, but she fights these struggles and makes sure at the end of the day that she is happy inside out, because a happy family starts with her, the light of their home.  She desires to see her business grow and presently looks for other sources of income. She also prays that her husband and children would have stable jobs and that her two younger children will finish their schooling.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy frozen food to resell

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, es empleada, vive con su esposo y su hija de 2 años, ella trabaja en una pastelería, de este trabajo obtiene los ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Actualmente tiene la necesidad de reparar una bomba de pozo de agua, ya que esta bomba es la que se encarga del paso del agua por la tubería para la vivienda, ella solicita un préstamo para el pago de la mano de obra que trabajaran para arreglarla.
El objetivo de ella es tener en buenas condiciones las herramientas necesarias en su vivienda, además que para un futuro desea aprender el negocio de la pastelería  e instalar su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca has a job. She lives with her husband and their daughter, who is two years old. She works in a pastry shop and with this work she obtains the income to cover the needs of her family.

Now she needs to repair a pump in a water well, since this pump is what delivers the water through the pipes to her house. She is applying for the loan to pay for the labor to fix it.

Her goal is to have the necessary fixtures in her house in good condition. In addition, in the future she wants to learn the pastry business and start up her own business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to repair a water pump

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en: Leoncie is 33 years old, and she has three children who are aged six to nine years old. Her husband is a driver. Leoncie sells second-hand clothes and she has been selling these clothes for the past ten years. This business has enabled her to buy a piece of land on which she plans to build a house. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to buy another piece of land.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen resides in Reussey Keo commune, located in Phnom Penh. In previous times, she used to operate a small business selling fish in the busy market, but now she is a homemaker who manages the household and other cash flow in the total family. 

Mrs. Sen is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children, three married and two single. She currently relies on her children who work; one is a cloth seller and the other one is a garment factory worker who has a specific salary. Mrs. Sen is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motor which will be used by one of her kids to ride to work and also to mend her old house which is in need of repair.

loans.use: a motor which will use by her kid to ride to work and also to mend her old house.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis de oficio carpintero, con 31 años de edad, casado y con dos hijos. Inicia a la edad de 16 años con capital propio realizando trabajos menores a personas particulares y haciendo mesas pequeñas, las cuales comerccializaba en la ciudad de Sebaco, con la ayuda de un familiar, contando en ese entonces solamente con esos ingresos. Luis, solicitó su crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo,compra de materia como madera  , tornillo,pegamento para elaboracion de muebles el cual le ayudará a tener mejores ingresos y por la tanto asi mejorar su calidad de vida para él y su familia. Los planes futuros son incrementar su negocio y sub contratar a dos personas que le ayuden a elaborar e impulsar sus productos.
texts.en:
Luis, 31, is married, has two children and is a carpinter by trade.  He started his business with his own money when he was 16, and used to do jobs such as making small tables for people.  He sold them throughout the city of Sebaco with help from a relative, and that was his only source of income.

Luis has requested a loan to increase his working capital so he can buy wood, glue and screws to make furniture.  This will help him increase his income and improve his family's lifestyle.  In the future he would like to expand his business and hire two workers to help him make and market his products.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as wood, glue and screws.

loans.name: Paddy

texts.en:
Paddy is a forty-one-year-old married man with four children; he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been a farmer dealing in maize and poultry for twelve years. He acquired initial capital from his salary as a teacher. His hardships are the price fluctuations of maize, lack of enough capital, and prolonged drought. Nonetheless he longs to set up a food store and increase the size of his poultry farm, plus educate his children. 

Paddy needs the loan to buy poultry feed and hire labor to harvest his maize.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed and hire labor to harvest his maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Humbert

texts.es:
Humberto está planeando recibir su segundo credikiva para continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, porque con el primero logró invertirlo en la compra de mercancías y en la reparación de 2 lavadoras y la compra de dos nuevas máquinas, con todo esto logró incrementar sus ingresos y respondió con ello a su clientela. En la actualidad comprará dos lavadoras más, reparará la vitrina para la exhibición de mercancía y el mantenimiento de dos máquinas que se encuentran dañadas. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Estoy muy agradecido por el crédito que me han dado, ya que he podido seguir trabajando y todo me ha salido muy bien.”


Si usted quiere leer la historia de Humberto, ingrese al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/214206
texts.en:
Humberto is planning on receiving his second Kiva loan to continue increasing working capital because he used the first one to buy merchandise and to repair two washing machines and to buy two new machines.  With all this he succeeded in increasing income and was able to respond to his clientele.  

Currently, he will buy two more washing machines, will repair the merchandise display case and will repair two machines that are broken.  His message for lenders is: “I am very grateful for the loan I’ve been given because I’ve been able to continue working and everything has turned out very well.” 

If you’d like to read Humberto’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/214206

loans.use: to buy two washing machines, to repair the display case and to repair two broken machines.

loans.name: Bety Eugenia

texts.es: Bety Eugenia de 40 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero de vida y su hija la cual ya es mayor de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para todos los gustos, tamaños y preferencia, llo hace de forma ambulante y también en su misma casa. Ya tiene varios años de dedicarce al negocio razón por la cual ya cuanta con mucha clientela establecida. Además es una mujer carismática, emprendedora y dedicada a su trabajo. Los clientes la prefieren ya que cuando de ropa se trata ella tiene lo mejor tanto en precios como en variedad.  Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer y poder cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita aumentar su nivel de ventas y por consecuencia su nivel de ingresos. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir (faldas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, etc.). Que le permitan lograr el sueño de su vida con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
40-year-old Bety Eugenia lives in her own home together with her life partner and her grown-up daughter.  Her business is selling clothes for all tastes, sizes and preferences.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and also sells from home.  She has been in this business for several years and so already has a lot of existing customers.  In addition, Bety Eugenia is a charismatic, entrepreneurial woman who is committed to her work.  Her customers are loyal to her business because, when it comes to clothes, she has the best prices and the best variety.

Bety Eugenia's dream is to see her business thrive and to be able to deal with greater demand, which would allow her to increase her sales levels and, thereby, her income.  This has motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL, so that she can invest in her business by purchasing a variety of garments (skirts, pants, shirts, dresses, etc).  This will enable her to achieve her dream in life, improving her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes such as skirts, pants, shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is a 35-year-old married woman. She has one child, age 3, for whom she hopes to provide good education to the university level. She describes herself to be religious and customer friendly. 

Jenipher operates a pharmacy, where she sells medicine to the local people in Mombasa. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition, leading to decreased sales volume. She will use the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan to purchase medicine. Her business goal is to grow it to wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy medicine.

loans.name: Teglorma Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Teglorma” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek for a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Musu. Musu was born in Tongo town, in eastern Sierra Leone about 35 years ago. She is married to a school teacher and the couple has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Musu has been selling palm-oil and meat for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy gallons of palm-oil and a large quantity of meat for sale.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm-oil and a large quantity of meat for sale

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, es soltero, no tiene hijos, él es empleado, trabaja como promotor municipal en comunidades solidarias rurales, su horario es de 8:00am a 4:00pm.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, lo cual necesita cemento, arena, ladrillo, porque se encuentra construyendo un cuarto en la vivienda, el préstamo será una gran ayuda para realizar la construcción y de su trabajo poco a poco pagar la deuda.
La aspiración de José es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo, pueda mejorar la vivienda, ofreciendo a sus padres mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
José lives with his family. He is single and has no children. José is a municipal employee and works as a promoter in the unified rural communities. His work schedule is from 8am to 4pm.

José is requesting a loan to buy construction materials. He needs cement, sand, and bricks because he is building a room in his home. This loan will be a great help so that he can complete the construction. With his job, he can gradually pay off this debt.

Through work and effort, José aspires to continue making improvements to his home so that his parents will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks for building a room.

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
La Señorita. Blanca es socia del banco comunal Poloma, vive por una comunidad que se encuentra en la parroquia del Valle (Cuenca), lugar que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas muy carismáticas y amables quienes se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señorita Blanca tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa con sus padres, su papá se dedica a la carpintería y su mamá a la crianza de animales, la casa en la que habitan es propiedad de sus padres.

Ella trabaja en un gabinete de belleza solo medio día de lunes a sábados. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y pollos para iniciar en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Poloma communal bank. She lives in a community located in the parish of El Valle (Cuenca). It is a place characterized by its beautiful landscapes. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are charismatic and friendly and work in trade, raising animals and in farming. Many work in the city in different activities.

Blanca is 19 years old, single and lives in her parents house. Her father works as a carpenter and her mother raises animals. Her parents own their house.  

She works in a beauty salon part time Monday though Saturday.  

This is her first loan with the communal bank, which she was invited to join by her sister. The money from the loan will be invested un buying pigs and chickens to start this activity.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Salamatu from Calabatown, Eastern Area, Freetown. She is married with one child. She has four additional dependents that live with her because they are relatives. They also assist her with her business.   

Salamatu runs a cosmetic and pharmacy store.  She sells malaria drugs, cough syrup, anti-fungal cream, baby oil, and body cream.   She also receives income from her husband, who is also doing business. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to buy more malarial drugs, cough syrups, anti-fungal creams, baby oils, and body creams.   The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living.  In the future, she plans to increase her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more malaria drugs, cough syrup, anti-fungal cream and baby oil.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
This is Concepcion, 49, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a construction worker, and she is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Concepcion operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively separated in the Philippines, and, while waiting for their local dump trucks, people search the garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper, and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a small profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, like factories and other like businesses. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Concepcion hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams that she will be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work at her business. Every week, she faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia nació en la ciudad D. Maras y vive en la comunidad D. Paucarbamba, ella tiene 62 años D. edad y es viuda pero tiene ocho hijos.

Felicia desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Paucarbamba, ella se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como pollos, cuyes y otros mas, ella también se dedica la venta D. granos secos como maíz, cebada, trigo y otros mas. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Felicia tambien venD. chicha D. jora. 

Felicia requiere el préstamo para comprar más chanchos y granos secos. 

Felicia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Felicia pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción D. Pachar” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad D. Urubamba.
texts.en:
She works in Paucarbamba, where she raises small animals such as chickens, Guinea pigs, and others.  She also sells dried grains such as corn, barley, wheat, and others.  She’s been doing this for several years and things have been going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She also sells chicha.

Felicia needs this loan to buy more pigs and dried grain.
 
She is grateful for the opportunity given her through this medium and is committed to making her payments on time.  Felicia is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” communal bank of the Arariwa Association in Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy pigs and grain.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat, 58, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a plastic handbag vendor and her husband is a carpenter. Additionally, her husband produces palm sugar to sell in order to generate extra income to support the family. Her daughter is a garment worker and her son is a construction worker. Nat requests a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital in her business in order to purchase more plastic handbag to resell at the market. She hopes she will finish building her house (shown in the photo) after getting this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic handbag to resell.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Sandy has a shop that sells coconuts and green and yellow bananas. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy bananas to sell. Sandy has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Sandy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas for sale

loans.name: Grupo Triunfador Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal esta formado por 8 emprendedores  que día a día lucha por salir adelante junto con su familia. Este grupo ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000,  en cual han demostrado que son unidos, responsable y que sus objetivos es  crecer con sus negocios, ellos nos expresa que gracias al financiamiento han aumentado su inventario y esto ha permitido que tengan mayores clientes en sus negocios. Juana es una de los miembros y es la presidente del grupo que los motiva al resto de sus compañeros para que salgan adelante. Juana sus actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería que anteriormente solicito para aumentar su inventario. Actualmente esta solicitando crédito para abastecer el negocio y ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos de uso en el hogar como granos básicos, golosinas, jabones, aceite entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank has 8 entrepreneurs who day by day fight to get head together with their family. This group has had loans through Fundación León 2000, and have shown themselves to be united and trustworthy, and their goal is to grow with their businesses. They have expressed to us their thanks for the loans, which have expanded their inventory and have permitted them to have more customers in their businesses. 

Juana is one of the members and she is the president of the group who motivates the rest of the members to get ahead. Juana has a grocery store and as she has in the past she is asking for a loan to increase her inventory. 

Currently she is asking for a loan in order to stock the business to be able to offer her customers a variety of products to use in the home such as basic grains, sweets, soap, oil and other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, soap, and oil and other products

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old, married and has two children. She sells sand, ballast and cement.  She has been in the business for six years.  She has employed four people in the business.  She also runs a cafeteria for more income generation.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business and become more financially stable.  She has requested a loan to buy sand, ballast and cement.

loans.use: To buy sand, ballast and cement

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
The lady with a scalf on her head is Jenifer. She is 36 years old, widow and a mother of two. She is a member of the God's time Group which joined Hand with Jennifer in ID-Ghana and has benefited from all the training.

She sell plastic bowls,plastic buckets and ice chest. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more plastic bowls,buckets and ice chest for distributions to her buyers. This will greatly boost her business activity hence increase her income. This will enable her cater for her children’s clothing, food and education expenses.

Rosemary is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls,buckets and ice chest for distributions to her buyers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Latoi would like to buy three more steers

loans.name: Yaya

texts.en:
Married and mother of five children, Mrs. A. specializes in the preparation of pulp that she has been selling for one year, after having been the beneficiary of her first loan from HELP Africa.

She sells the pulp each morning and night, along with beans, millet, etc.

Preparation is composed of three ingredients: • Millet-based pulp • Sorghum • Maize

Mrs. A. is very limited by her current channels, despite the demand for her product. Her first loan was $75. Her pulp-making business is called “Akassa,” because students buy it during their breaks. It’s a pulp made of sorghum or of millet that is very good for children in school who do not have a way to buy anything more expensive to eat.

With the loan money, she can establish a monthly stock of the afore mentioned necessary ingredients. She will buy sugar, sorghum, millet, etc.

Mrs. A. is a member of the HELP Africa solidarity group “Godwin”, which collectively has applied for a loan of $300. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

loans.use: Buy corn and sorghum inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria S. is 24 years old. She learned her hair-dressing service for 3 years. She wishes that the above amount come to her for business expansion

loans.use: To buy more hair-dressing equipment

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
Genara's first loan through Pro Mujer allowed her to stock up on some groceries for her door-to-door sales. Ms Genara S. has 13 years of experience in this field of work, which has allowed the business to prosper significantly. Currently, Genara is a mother of two children who attend the university and owns a well-located grocery store in the 16th of July zone in the city of El Alto. Genara intends to maintain this store, but she also wants to open another type of business. Her friends have told her that the import of auto parts and automobiles yields a great income. To accomplish this, Genara asks for a loan for capital to travel overseas and purchase the necessary merchandise. This will help her create a more diverse business and improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El primer crédito desembolsado por Pro Mujer, le permitió abastecer con algunos víveres su puesto de ventas ambulante. La señora Genara S. tiene una antigüedad de 13 años en la organización, lo que le permitió prosperar de manera significativa. En la actualidad Genara es madre de dos hijos universitarios, y dueña de un almacén de abarrotes muy bien surtido en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto. La intención de Genara es mantener su almacén, pero incursionar en otro tipo de negocio, que según sus compañeras, reditúa mucho mas, y consiste en la importación de autopartes y automóviles. Para este fin, Genara necesita de capital para poder realizar viajes al exterior, y comprar la mercadería necesaria, de esta manera dar un giro en el rubro de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To invest capital

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong and his family live in Lap Phuoc hamlet in the T. lap commune of Ham Thuan Nam district.

Cuong's household has a total of four members: Cuong and his his wife and their two children who are very young (three and four years old, respectively). Cuong works as a day laborer. His wife plants maize and raises several chickens.

Together, their average income is $10 USD per month/person. They wish to borrow $75 USD to buy a cow so that it can reproduce. They will pay back the loan over the course of seven months.

loans.use: To raise a cow

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Borey was married in 1980 and has 3 children, one son and two daughters. She has been in the business of planting and selling flowers and vegetables since 1990. Her husband is also in the business of planting flowers and vegetables with her.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times before. Now she is asking for a loan of $1,100. She will use this loan to purchase one motorbike and buy fertilizer and pesticide for planting flowers and vegetables.

loans.use:
Purchasing one motorbike and buying fertilizer and 
pesticide for planting flowers and vegetables

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en: Tautala is a thirty eight year old mother of four children. Tautala is still responsible of taking care of her two independents and she is making sure that the business is good to support them not only physically but also mentally in schooling. This is her fourth loan and she also intends to spend money on improving the plantation. She goes to the market two days a week and she can earn $400 WST ($160 USD) during that time period. She is thankful for the opportunity to be involved in the programme and to have these loans to help run their businesses.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation and iron roofing for home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She needs the loan to purchase goods and to pay for an operation

loans.name: Nyenga West C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Faridah S.. She is currently in the business of operating a hardware shop and is requesting a loan to buy more hardware materials. Faridah is 28 years old and is married with a husband that is a farmer. She has 1 child aged 4 who does not go to school. Each week, Faridah makes approximately UGX 28600 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a nursery school. Faridah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more goods for the shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Faridah is joined in her small group by Oliver K., Florence K., Musa S., and Kizza N.. Oliver K. has a beauty salon business and wants to buy more salon equipment. Flornece K. is currently operating a poultry farm and wants a loan to buy local chickens. Musa S. also operates a poultry farm and wants to buy more chicks and chicken feed. Kizza N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more materials.

loans.use: To boost hardware business by increasing stock.

loans.name: Agala

texts.en: B. Agala, who is married to a mechanic, has three children.  Working in the food sector, she prepares and sells fried yam near a new taxi rank at night. Her food sales are increasing daily and she desire to expand her production, but lacks the funds to achieve her target. Thus, she is asking for $525 as an additional fund to buy more yams, oil and other food stuff to expand her food production and sales.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun Y. and her husband married in 1979. They have seven children - two sons and five daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home and the other three daughters are garment factory workers. Their two sons are in school. The family is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Oeun has been selling fruit for two years. She buys mangoes and sapodillas from a farmer in the village, then puts them up for resale at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a carpenter for twenty years.

Mrs. Oeun is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase fruit for resale and fill in the land around the house.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale and fill in the land around the house

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca started her business to support herself financially, being that her husband’s income was very little and was not enough to cover the household’s expenses. Additionally, he was laid off from his previous employment two months ago, and his current one does not pay very well.

She started in December of 2003, with a savings fund her husband was given by his employer. She decided to sell seasonal clothing and it worked well for her. She started by selling to her relatives for holiday gift exchanges, and also to friends and neighbors. Shortly thereafter, she added the sale of notions in a smaller scale.

She now needs a loan for US $400, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise. This will be a great help for her since she will take advantage of the season, which is when she can make higher earnings from her sales. With your support, Francisca will prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca inició el negocio para ayudarse económicamente, ya que el ingreso de su esposo era muy poco y no alcanzaba con los gastos de la casa, además lo liquidaron hace 2 meses de su empleo y en donde labora actualmente no esta muy bien remunerado.

Comenzó en diciembre del 2003, con el fondo de ahorro que le entregaron a su esposo en donde trabajaba, decidió ponerse a vender ropa de temporada y le funciono; empezó vendiéndoles a sus familiares, para los intercambios navideños y con vecinos y amigos. Posteriormente agrego la venta de mercería en pequeño.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y le será de gran ayuda ya que aprovecharía nuevamente la temporada, y es cuando puede tener mas ingresos en sus ventas, Con tu apoyo Frnacisca saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar D. is a woman who sells women’s clothing. She was successful in using her first loan and would now like to increase her loan in order to increase her product assortment. She will use the loan when she travels to purchase summer women’s blouses and skirts.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Дильбар Джураева, женщина которая торгует на рынке ,а также имеет отдел по продаже женской одежды.Первый займ она использовала удачно, теперь хочет увеличить займ для увеличения ассортимента, хочет поехав за товарм закупить летний ассортимент женских блузок и юбок.

loans.use: Purchase women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en:
Mr. Cheam B. is a farmer in Thmey Tumlop Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In addition, he sells pigs door-to-door. His wife, Mrs. Pho Suy, helps with farming and sews palm leaves to use as thatch roofing material. Mr. Cheam B. is 35 and the father of four children, three of whom attend school; the youngest is still too young.

Even though Mr. Cheam B. and his wife have several business activities, they still cannot support their family. Thus, Mr. Cheam B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mr. Cheam B. and his wife are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Fatma's Asaa Khery Group

texts.en:
Fatma is a 48 year old single woman with 2 children, aged 17 and 6. She sells "bites", the local name for bread and cake. Every day, she works from 6 A.M. to 7 P.M. at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fatma now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Afua and Tatu, who have businesses selling bites, charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha B., 54, and her husband, Mr. Un Choen, 56, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1975 and have six children: one son and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other three children weave silk at home. Mr. Un is a farmer.

Mrs. Sokha has been a silk weaver since she was married, using a skill he learned from her neighbor. She sells the family's finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Sokha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her daughter to weave.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Maria Asuncion

texts.es: La señora Asuncion J. es una señora de 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos el mayor cursa el cuarto año de secundaria tiene 18 años de edad, su otra hija es una jovencita de 14 años de edad y cursa el segundo años de secundaria y su ultimo hijo tiene  8 años y cursa el tercer grado de primaria, el padre de sus hijos tambien es comerciante no tiene un ingreso fijo, Uno de sus propositos de Doña suncion es poder mejorar su casa de habitacion, comprar una terreno y construir por consiguiente darle un techo digno a sus hijos, sacarlos adelante en sus estudios es decir ayudarle en lo mas que se pueda. La actividad economica de la señora es la comercializacion de ropa en general, calzado nacional masaya, y cosmeticos, la señora compra en managua y comercializa de forma ambulante ya que no tiene un lugar establecido, teniendo mas de 19 años de dedicarse a este negocio y es con lo cual ha sacado adelante a su familia, esperando contar con el apoyo de nuestra institucion a  traves de los prestamos que son invertidos en capital de trabajo exclusivamente
texts.en:
Ms. Asuncion J. is a woman of 42 years old. She is a single mother with three children. The oldest is in his fourth year of high school and is 18 years old. Her daughter is a young lady of 14 years and is in the second year of high school. Her youngest son is 8 years old and is in the third grade. The father of her children is a merchant who does not have a fixed income. One of Asuncion's goals is to be able to make improvements to her house, to buy land, and build to then give a decent roof to her children. She wants to see her children advance in their studies, that is to say, to help them in as much as she can.

Asuncion's economic activity is selling clothing, local footwear, and cosmetics. She buys them in Managua and sells them through traveling sales, since she does not have an established place. She has spent over 19 years working in this business and it is what she has used to get her family ahead. She hopes to count on the support from our institution through loans, which are invested exclusively in working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for her business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is an entrepreneur from Kamenka. It has been hard to provide for her family after she lost her husband and became a widow. She sells bedding, towels, terry cloth robes and other bath accessories in the central city market. Yelena started this venture with the help of her friends who had lent her the amount she needed to get going. 

Yelena has been in business for 8 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about 10,000 Grivnas. Monthly net profit is about 3,000 Grivnas. Yelena loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She is grateful for the opportunity this business has given, not only to provide for herself, but also to help her children. 

We are hoping the current loan of 1,500 Grivnas will help Yelena’s business in this busy season when markets in Kamenka are flooded with potential buyers. Yelena has promptly repaid 25 loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Note: this is a short-term express loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: open an additional vending facility and purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Mrs. Sona L., 27, has been a rice farmer since 2000. This is her main source of income, and she currently earns approximately $2.66 each day. Sona has no children and is married to Mr. Eoun Kim, 28, who is a construction worker. They in Koktlokkroam Commune in Siem Reap Province. Sona requests a loan of $500 to buy two oxen to help her plow her farm. (Sona and her husband are in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy two oxen

loans.name: Harriet Kamanyi ‘S Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the leader of a 4-member group. She is a 30-year-old mother of 5 children who are between the ages of 6 and 19 years old. All of her children are currently attending school. At the same time, she takes care of additional family members. She rents and resides in a two-room house where she lives with seven other people. Although they have electricity, they have no piped water at their home. She notes that her family eats three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. Specifically, she owns and operates a bar from her home. On average, she sells beverages to 20 customers per day, and she works seven days per week. She explains that she has been a client of MCDT for one month, and that this is the first loan she has sought via the organization. With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional crates of beverages (e.g., beer and soda)

loans.name: Shabana Group

texts.en:
Shabana is the group leader of the Shabana group. There are three members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for her business.

Shakaba and Shabana want to take a loan for their husbands' fruit cart businesses and they want to buy necessary materials for their businesses. Also, Hanefa wants to take a loan for her business of beading. She wants to complete her stock. They are requesting a loan of 42000 Afghani for a term of 9 months.

They want to say that this loan is very useful because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to complete their stock

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M., 54 years old, lives in Barangay Lapogan Tumauini, Isabela. She is married to Claro who operates their passenger tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) and sometimes hires out as a carpenter in their village and other villages if there is available carpentry work or if someone asks him to do carpentry. They have six children, Mario – 31 years old elementary undegraduate, same as Allan –who is now 30 years old; Danilo – 26 years old, unfortunately did not enter any grades; Clarita – 21 years old, high school graduate, Catherine – 19 years old high school graduate; and Clary – 14 years old, grade six student.

Lolita is looking forward to receiving a loan amounting to PHP 5, 000 as assistance for their passenger "tricycle" business. The amount will be utilized to maintain the operation of their motorcycle daily. Some will also be used by Lolita to start up a new business: buying and selling vegetables, provided they still have enough funds to start up said business.

According to Lolita, she will work with her husband for their family's welfare because they really want to improve their life and ultimately overcome poverty. Part of her goal in life is to finally finish their house for her family's safety and comfort because until now, it is still unfinished.

loans.use: to sustain their passenger "tricycle" business

loans.name: Veronica Adhiambo

texts.en: Veronica Adhiambo O. is a 26 year old mother of three children, ages five, ten and 12. She wants to sell vegetables and fish from a stall in Kisumu, but is lacking the start-up capital. The loan will be used to buy stock and to grow her business into something sustainable.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fish to sell

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.en:
Juan Ramon S. is a married, 63-year old micro business entrepreneur. He has a 34 year-old son who works and lives with his own family.

Juan has been operating a bicycle buy and repair shop for the last ten years. He would like to increase his inventory of bicycle parts and full outfits. For this reason, he seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders.

He has previously received loans from Fundación León to help supplement his income, but now desires a loan for specific business development. Juan dreams of making enough money to one day make improvements to his home and provide his wife with few financial worries during their retirement.

Juan Ramon S. would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping him improve him life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: Purchase more bicycle repair supplies.

loans.name: Monica M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 56 year old Monica M. M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with 8 children, between the ages of 18 and 40. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents cannot care for them.  Monica has been running a bar since 2000. Her bar is a good place to relax with a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. You can relax on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’  (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to everyone who happens to wander by.  Monika works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Monica currently earns about 230USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300USD in order to purchase more drinks in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the range of her business. Monica thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Lora

texts.en:
Lora C. has worked as a seamstress and owner of a tailoring shop for more than two years. She runs her business as a primary source of family income and as a way of putting into practice the knowledge she has obtained over the years.

Initially Lora lacked the capital resources needed to increase her business, and so the realization of her ambition had to be put off for some time. This situation led her husband to make a hard decision to leave his family in search of a job and better earnings abroad, a decision that thousands of other Moldovans have also reached. With the money thus earned by her husband, Lora started her business in 2007, and it has grown extensively ever since. With a loan of 30000 MDL borrowed from Microinvest for 12 months, she will buy a new sewing machine and other accessories needed for her work.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and other accessories

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Jacqueline Gutiérrez tiene 44 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hijos, casada su esposo le ayuda económicamente. El objetivo que ella se ha puesto es brindarle a su familia una estabilidad tanto económica en cual unas de las prioridades es la construcción de su vivienda. Doña Jacqueline de profesión u oficio costurera y agregando la comercialización de productos de cereales y otros productos de alimentación ya que adquiere otros ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida, tiene 11 años de experiencia en el ramo de ofrecerle al cliente su servicio de costura y la iniciación de la elaboración de los cereales naturales. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic adquirió oportunidades para crecer como empresaria. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de materia prima de costura y productos como: maíz, cacao, semilla de jícaro, carne de cerdo, etc.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Gutiérrez is 44 years old, she lives in Villa Reconciliación. She has three children, is married and her husband helps her economically. The aim she has is to provide her family with economic stability for which one of the priorities is the construction of their home. Jacqueline is by profession a seamstress and she also sells cereal and other food products in order to have more income with which to improve her quality of life. She has 11 years experience in the field of offering clients a tailoring service and starting the production of cereals. Thanks to the loans she has received from Afodenic she has acquired opportunities to grow as a businesswoman. The loan she is asking for it to purchase the raw materials for sewing and products such as maize, coco, pumpkin seeds, pork meat etc.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material and grains such as maize, coco, pumpkin seeds in order to make cereals

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Sim P., 65, and her husband, age 61. They currently live in Siem Reap Province.

Sim P. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also cultivates a rice crop, while her husband works as a local carpenter. They have six children, four of whom are single and the other two are married; they also work with her in pig raising.

Presently, Sim P. faces difficulty with transportation in that she always hires a taxi when she needs transportation. To reduce the cost of transportation, she would like a $1200 loan in order to buy a new motorbike for her family's riding needs.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her family's riding needs

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is thirty eight years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has all of the children in school.

She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for ten years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil. She produces and supplies to food vendors who use it to prepare their meals and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods elsewhere when demand becomes very high.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts and gallons (containers) to store the oil to increase her efficiency by producing in larger quantities. She believes this will help to expand her business, to raise more income to support her husband, to provide food for her family and to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called “Nyame Mere” meaning “God’s Time”.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency

loans.name: Kondi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  est un homme marié qui habite avec sa femme et ses enfants le quartier de hedzranawoé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de lomé. l’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est la vente de cartes de recharge. Ce commerce est très rentable à lomé. Il veut agrandir son stock de cartes de recharge par l’achat de 4 cartons de cartes togocel et 03 cartons de cartes moov pour cela il sollicite son premier crédit de wages
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and lives with his wife and children in Hedzranawoé, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. His revenue-generating business, for providing for his family, involves selling mobile phone recharge cards. This is a very profitable business in Lomé. He wants to expand his stock of recharge cards by buying four boxes of Togocel cards and three boxes of Moov cards. To do so, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add stock of flour, beans and maize

loans.name: Mouna

texts.en:
Mouna is a 40-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2005 to provide, along with her brother, better living conditions for the family.

Today, Mouna is requesting $1,100 to purchase a new sewing machine for her work to satisfy the demands of her clientele.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita D. is from the village of Romarate in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 67 years old. Anecita is married and has 1 adult children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store where she sells daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Anecita's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Moutawakilou

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme s’est spécialisé dans vente d’huile à moteur dans le quartier d’Agoè Zongo à Lomé ; il a débuté cette activité depuis 1999 et ce commerce lui permet surtout de se prendre en charge et de subvenir à ses besoins. Il se rend parfois au Nigéria pour s’approvisionner en huile à moteur mais aussi au Bénin le pays voisin. Son commerce se situe en bordure d’un rue très fréquentée par les taxis motos, ce qui fait qu’il dispose de beaucoup de clients. Actuellement il a besoin de renouveler son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 250 litres d’huile à moteur. Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
This is a young man who became specialized in selling motor oil in the Agoè Zongo district in Lomé; he started this business in 1999, and it enables him in particular to be self-reliant and to provide for himself. He sometimes goes to Nigeria to stock up on motor oil but also to Benin, the neighboring country. His business is located on a roadside bustling with moto taxis, which means he has many customers. At present, he needs to renew his stock. For this reason, he would like to obtain a WAGES loan to buy 250 liters of motor oil. He is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motor oil

loans.name: Benter Achieng

texts.en: Benter H., 36, is married with four children ranging from 9 to 19 years old.  While she originally just sold charcoal, she has expanded her inventory to foodstuffs and household products and has one employee.  Her kiosk serves households and she struggles with fixed prices for her goods.  This KES20,000 loan will enable her to expand and deepen her offerings of foods as well as the ever popular scratch cards.  Benter considers herself to be a responsible hardworking vendor and she aspires to expand her business further.  Ultimately, she would like to purchase some land for development.

loans.use: Add additional items for sale including sugar, salad, flour as well as scratch cards.

loans.name: Maximina Florisa

texts.es: La señora MAXIMINA FLORISA H. D. F., tiene 67 años, vive en el distrito D. Trujillo, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 1ero D. primaria, refiere que sus padres la enviaron a la escuela para que aprenda a escribir su nombre, leer un poco y aprender a firmar porque ellos consideraban que sólo eso era necesario, para que luego empiecen a trabajar. Por ese motivo ella empezó a trabajar desD. pequeña tanto en el campo como en casa. La socia tiene 2 hijas ya mayores quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella. Maximina se dedica a la venta D. menús, cervezas, gaseosas, quesos, quesillos, manjar blanco (dulce D. leche) en el restaurante D. su casa. Con su  primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles compro sacos D. arroz, sacos D. papa, gaseosas y cerveza al por mayor, queso ,manjar blanco y quesillo para que venda en el restaurante que tiene instalado en su casa . Con el crédito D. 3,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos D. arroz, sacos D. papa, gaseosas y cerveza al por mayor, queso ,manjar blanco y quesillo. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener mayores ganancias y así hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximina Florisa H. D. F., 67, lives in the Trujillos district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the San Luis Communal Bank. She has a first graD. education. Her parents sent her to school to learn how to write her name, read a little, and to learn how to sign her name because they believed that was all that was necessary to later start working. She started working in the fields and at home when she was little. She has two grown daughters who are not economically dependent upon her. Maximina sells prepared dishes, beer, soft drinks, cheese, “quesillos” (local cheese), and “manjar blanco” (a sweet caramel maD. from condensed milk, similar to dulce D. leche) in the restaurant in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought sacks of rice, sacks of potatoes, soft drinks, wholesale beer, cheese, “manjar blanco”, and “quesillos” to sell in the restaurant that she has installed in her house. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy sacks of rice, sacks of potatoes, soft drinks, wholesale beer, cheese, “manjar blanco”, and “quesillos” . She dreams of increasing her sales to be able to get greater income to make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice, sacks of potatoes, soft drinks, wholesale beer, cheese, “manjar blanco”, and “quesillos” .

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is 47 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a government worker. To make a living, Caroline sells electrical parts in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a focused, hard worker. She hopes to be the sole distributor of electrical parts in her community in Lagos state. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more electrical parts to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical parts to sell

loans.name: Elpedio

texts.en:
Elpedio I. owns and operates a specialized retail store and also has a business making furniture for sale in his community. He is 45 years old, married and has five grown-up children.
