She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar Antonio vive en el Barrio de Managua de San Caralampio, con su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos adolecentes que actualmente estudian, la escuela secundaria, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 20 años y fue con el apoyo de la Reforma Agraria de los 90s que lograron adquirir su terreno, y desde ese momento se a convertido en el sustento económico de la familia, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos vegetativos, fertilizantes y fungicidas que realicen un mantenimiento fito Sanitario optimo para la mejora continua de su producción, el aumento en las ventas de las cosechas y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para todos los miembro de su familia, especialmente por su hijo mayor que pronto ingresara a la universidad y esperan contar con los recursos económicos para solventar su carrera profesional y ofrecerle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Antonio lives in Managua’s San Caralampio neighborhood with his life partner and three adolescent children who are in secondary school.  

They have been farmers for over 20 years thanks to help from the Agrarian Reform in the90s that made it possible for them to acquire land.  Since then it’s been the family’s main source of support.

He needs the loan for his business.  To buy farming supplies, fertilizers and fungicides to provide proper maintenance to his crops so that production will be optimized and sales will increase thus improving his family’s quality of life, especially is oldest son’s who is about to enroll in the university and he hopes to have economic resources sufficient to pay for his professional training offering him a better future.

loans.use: For crop maintenance.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon L. is a good homemaker who cares for the children and does housework. Mrs. Mon L. currently depends on the income from her husband’s work. He provides a well-digging service. His skill is digging wells by hand, and he has been working at it for years. He makes $7 a day to buy food for his family. Mrs. Mon L.’s husband has been very busy at his business as many clients need him to dig their wells. He is, however,  lacking materials to perform his service. Therefore, Mrs. Mon L. has requested a loan for his husband to purchase more digging materials.

loans.use: To purchase more digging materials.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old married man with a child. He lives in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda, but he has a dream to build his own house in the next five years. He is a motorcycle rider and has been in the transportation sector for three years. The business is still profitable despite the challenge of remitting the biggest percentage of his daily income to the owner of the motorcycle. John needs the credit facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Aitilla Attokurova's Group

texts.en:
Aitilla A., 47, is the treasurer of this group. She has gathered a group of hard-working and persistent entrepreneurs with exceptional skills and knowledge in their sphere. The joint application of their skills will play a big role in promoting the business and successfully repaying the loan. 

Aitilla is the mother of two boys and the wife of a farmer. Like many other women, she is engaged in trade. For the past three years, she’s been working in a local open air bazaar selling consumer goods and groceries. Aitilla is very popular among her customers, who come from her neighborhood and the general community. She believes this loan will have a positive effect on her business. She works in this line of business thanks to her sister’s advice. Returns from business have allowed her to make the gift of a brand new car to her husband. Aitilla plans to invest the money in buying products to better implement her grocery store and expects to continue progressing. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods to resell

loans.name: Rheza

texts.en:
Rheza B. is from the village of Panalsalan. She is 33 years old. Rheza is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She is just starting this business.

In 2005, Rheza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Rheza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 11th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
Nelson desempeña las funciones de Montanista en una imprenta ya que el señor es grafico; con el dinero del préstamo podrá cubrir los gastos de matricula y el pago de mensualidades, pues está estudiando diseño gráfico. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención.

Nelson es soltero y vive en casa en la casa de sus padres en la zona de la Villa Bolívar D Ciudad de El Alto.
texts.en:
Nelson works as an editor in a printer's.  He is a graphic designer.  He will use his loan money to cover his registration fees and his monthly tuition fees since he is studying graphic design. This is his main source of income through which he supports himself.

Nelson is single and lives in his parents' home in Villa Bolívar D district, in the city of El Alto.

loans.use: To cover his registration fees and his monthly tuition fees so that he can study graphic design

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La sra. María A. C. es profesora de primaria tiene treinta y un año de ser maestra además es costurera en su tiempo libre ella hace sus trabajos de costura, es casada tiene dos hijos los hijos están casado,  se le han financiado once crédito los ha invertido en su negocio en la costura ahora esta solicitando financiamiento para la compra de una lavadora ya que la que tenia se le daño. Se siente agradecida con ceprodel por toda la oportunidades que le hemos dado para ir creciendo y poder tener sus electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
María A. C. has been an elementary school teacher for 31 years.  She is also a seamstress.  During her free time she does work sewing.   She is married and has two children.  The children are married.

She has had 11 loans, which she has used to invest in her seamstress business.  She is now requesting a loan to buy a washer because the one she had broke.  She is grateful to Ceprodel for all of the opportunities that we have given her so that she can continue growing and being able to have her domestic appliances.

loans.use: To buy a washer

loans.name: Wenniefreda

texts.en:
Wenniefreda D. G. is from the village of P-10 Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old. Wenniefreda is married and has three adult-age children. To make a living, she owns and operates a retail store. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Wenniefreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP To purchase variety of products such as can goods, shampoo etc. for her retail store. This will be her 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase variety of products such as can goods, shampoo etc. for her retail store

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas M. W. is a 36-year-old businessman who run a a cafeteria. He started the business four years ago. Apart from running a cafeteria, he does sugarcane farming so as to supplement his family’s income. He was previously operating a butcher shop.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has gained business ideas and developed business management skills. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested 15,000 KES to buy an energy-saving cooker, called a jiko.

loans.use: to buy an energy-saving cooker (jiko)

loans.name: Mirian Dora

texts.es: mirian tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo, hijos y nietos, ella se inició hace 2 años brindando pensión a sus vecinos, actualmente atienD. a mas D. 20 personas al día, todos la reconocen por su buena sazón y amabilidad en la atención, ella desea invertir en la compra D. utensilios e insumos para su negocio y D. esta manera generar mas ingresos, mirian sueña con tener su restaurante y así poder darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en: Mirian is 53 years old. She lives with her husband, children, and grandchildren. Two years ago she began cooking meals for her neighbors. She now cooks for more than 20 people per day. Everyone knows her because of her good cooking and her friendly manner. She would like to buy utensils and ingredients for her business so that she can earn more income. Mirian dreams of having her own restaurant and bringing a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and supplies

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kem C. (pictured above) lives in a village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She is a widow and has three sons and one daughter. 

She grows different kinds of vegetables on her farmland.

Kem has asked for a Kiva loan once to purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to work in Phnom Penh. She now wants to buy one more motorbike for family use, so she is asking for another loan of $500 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Mohanad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has five children.

In 2000, Mohanad opened a shop for mobiles and electronic materials. He has good experience and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting $3,000 to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy more kinds of materials. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy more materials.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 25 years old. She has two children who are ages 2 and 6. Her husband sells foodstuffs. Olive sells second-hand clothes, and she has been doing this business for two years. From this business, she has managed to buy a piece a land for which she plans to build a house for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell in order to make more profits. With the profits she hopes to make, she plans to begin construction of her family house.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi makes gari in large quantities for distribution to her customers. In addition, she sells maize in Elmina. Gari is made from a starchy root vegetable called cassava. The process involves peeling, milling, squeezing the water from the dough, and stir-frying.

Esi is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Esi has been selling gari for 10 years now. She responsibly helps to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy cassava to process into gari for sale. She hopes to reinvest her new profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava to process into gari for sale.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
Milagro, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, es madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años de edad, ella vive con sus padres, y tiene el negocio desde hace un año, estos cerdos los compra pequeños, los alimenta  para comercializarlos en la zona.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos, también comprara medicinas y vitaminas para ellos,  esta compra le ayudara a tener suficiente alimento para los cerdos, garantizándose de poder venderlos a un buen precio.
El sueño de ella es instalar una tienda de productos domésticos, aumentar el número de cerdos en la granja y velar por las necesidades de su hijo.
texts.en:
Milagro raises pigs and is the mother of a 2-year-old son. She lives with her parents and has had her business for 1 year.  Milagro buys the pigs when they are small, feeds them, then sells them in the zone.

At present, Milagro is requesting a loan to buy feed concentrate to feed the pigs, and also to buy medicines and vitamins for them.  These purchases will help her have sufficient feed for her pigs, and guarantee that they can be sold at a good price.

Milagro's dream is to establish a domestic products store, increase the number of pigs she has, and to provide necessities for her son.

loans.use: buy feed, medicines, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 57 years old and lives in Maquilao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three adult-age children. Jovita has a small market at home selling assorted food products like food in pouches, canned goods, noodles, sweets and coffee. She has been running her business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional stock to sell.

Jovita has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Jovita hopes to expand her retail business and to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to use to fish.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Rainer

texts.en: Rainer is 30 years old and married with one daughter who is three years old. He works as a policeman in the city of Cusco. He is asking for a $600 loan in order to invest in his wife's restaurant. Her restaurant sells all types of traditional Peruvian food and is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Specifically, he plans to purchase basic necessities such as flour, sugar, corn, and rice for her restaurant. Rainer is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, corn, and rice for his wife's restaurant

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 42 years old. He and his wife Elizabeth are blessed with four children, aged twenty four, twenty one, seventeen, and five. He has been in the motorbike transport business for the past two years and has a monthly income of 9,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy another motorbike, which will increase his income.

He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to repair his motorbike. His hopes are to educate his children and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a small plot of land

loans.name: Turbat

texts.en:
Turbat is 35-year-old married man who lives with his spouse and son in an outer ger district (a district without a basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He is an electrician and previously had worked at the local university. 

Today, he supports his family by operating a small grocery store business in the ger district.  Mostly, his spouse helps him with the business, while their son attends secondary school. 

Turbat is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy a wider range of merchandise to sell in his grocery store.  His long-term aim is to buy a car to supplement his business transportation and to renovate his family home.

loans.use: to buy a wider range of merchandise to sell in his small grocery store.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: Así como las mujeres también existen hombres emprendedores este es el caso del señor Hugo de 64 años de edad,  su vida ha sido ejemplo y practica constante de un ferro espíritu de lucha, fundamentada en un profundo respeto por los valores; aspectos que se reflejan en su vida diaria. Pertenece al grupo Sarita Colonia con 6 integrantes, el cual lleva ese nombre en honor a la santa de la zona, el esta en el grupo ya 3 años. Hugo es un hombre casado, con cinco hijos, todos mayores de edad, el tiene un colegio es el director y docente de matemáticas, comenzó con 2 aulas y ahora tiene 7 aulas mas gracias a su esfuerzo junto con su esposa se pusieron una meta por cumplir y un desafío por realizar la mejoría económica de su hogar. Con el préstamo desea hacer  una inversión en mejorar las aulas del colegio.
texts.en: Just as there are entrepreneurial women, there are also entrepreneurial men. This is the case with Hugo, age 64. His life has been a constant practice and example of an iron-clad spirit of determination, rooted in a profound respect for values. These characteristics are reflected in his daily life. He belongs to the Sarita Colonia group with 6 members, which carries this name in honor of the patron saint of the area. Hugo has been in the group for 3 years. He is a married man with five children, all of them grown. He has a school, and he is the director and mathematics teacher. He started with 2 classrooms, and now he has 7 more classrooms, thanks to his efforts. Together with his wife, they set a goal to fulfill and a challenge to achieve economic improvement for their household. With the loan, he wants to make an investment in improving the school's classrooms.

loans.use: to invest in improving the classrooms of his school.

loans.name: Ripka

texts.en:
Ripka is a 47-year-old lady who originated from Ambon. She is married to Marthen, a 48-year-old man. From their marriage, Ripka and Marthen are blessed with three children. They are:
 	Kristin, 20 years old, 
 	Alwin, 16 years old, 
 	Lodowik, 11 years old.
Both Alwin and Lodowik are still at school.

Since she got married, Ripka spends her time as a housewife as well as a farmer. She plants bitter melon, tomatoes, cucumber, "kangkung", eggplant, etc. After the vegetables are harvested, Ripka will sell them to customers nearby the village and surroundings. She spends the income to meet their daily needs and to buy seed, petrol, and fertilizer. 

Ripka has a dream to plant various vegetables on the farm but she only has limited capital. Therefore, Ripka is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She plans to use the loan to purchase vegetable seed, fertilizer, pesticide and petrol for the tractor. She is hoping that TLM is willing to assist her through the loan.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seed, fertilizer, pesticide and petrol for the tractor.

loans.name: Ladis Carolina

texts.es:
Ladis de 42 años, una mujer trabajadora que cada día trata seguir adelante.

Es una vendedora de cosméticos, poco a poco fue desarrollándose con las ventas de sus productos.

En la actualidad vende su productos mediante de catálogos como revistas a sus vecinos y amigos.

Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio. Por eso ella solicita este préstamo para la compra de productos como: perfumes, cremas, etc.

Su sueño es que su clientela aumente y así que pueda mejorar cada día como vendedora de cosméticos.
texts.en: Ladis, 42, is a hardworking woman who strives to get ahead daily.  She sells cosmetics; she gradually developed in sales of these products.  At present, she sells her items via printed catalogues among her neighbors and friends.  She has many hopes for her business and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy products like perfume, creams, etc.  Her dream is that her clientele grows so that she can improve daily as a cosmetics saleswoman.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer consagrada a su familia, por lo que trabaja con gran dedicación, vende mercancía como ropa, perfumería y adicional a esto elabora accesorios para mujer, se siente afortunada por tener y un trabajo en el cual puede estar al frente de su hogar y manejar sus propios horarios.

Con la ilusión de tener un progreso continuo Cristina quiere comprar mercancía al por mayor para generar mas utilidades e insumos para la elaboración de los accesorios, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar dichas compras por lo que solicita un crédito para invertirle a su microempresa, generar mas ventas e insumos y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina is a woman devoted to her family, which is why she works with such dedication selling products like clothing and perfume, as well as women's accessories that she makes herself. She feels lucky to have a job that allows her to be at the front of her home and to manage her own hours. 

With the idea of continuing to move forward, Cristina wants to buy merchandise in bulk to generate more income, as well as parts for making the accessories, but she doesn't have the capital that she needs to make the purchases. For that reason, she has asked for a loan to invest in her small business so that she can sell more and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products and materials to stock her business.

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche, Adriana Patricia abre su tienda de productos de la canasta familiar que tiene desde hace 8 meses, después de dedicarse durante años a las ventas ambulantes. Esta emprendedora sueña con tener una tienda muy bien surtida. 

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido como fríjol, maíz, panela, arroz, entre otros productos que le permitirán mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: From 8 in the morning until 9 at night, Adriana Patricia opens her grocery store that she’s had for the last 8 months after having been a street vendor for years.  This entrepreneur dreams with having a very well stocked store.  She needs a loan at present to buy stock items like beans, corn, cheese and rice, among others in order to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
Sheriff is 40 years old and married with 1 child, age 10 years. He runs a general merchandise store in Lumley in Freetown, Sierra Leone.

He's been in this business for 10 years and sells bottled water, sugar, milk, stout, toilet rolls, Heineken and soft drinks at his store. He began this business because he needed to have a permanent source of income. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuation.

Sheriff requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more provisions and assorted drinks. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his child. In the future, Sheriff would like to import goods from overseas. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and assorted drinks to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Hernan

texts.es: Miguel, de 29 años de edad, casado, padre de tres hijos, de 8,7 y 3 años de edad. El es un humilde y sencillo comerciante vende frutas y verduras con un plástico de techo para cubrirse del sol, dos cajillas de plástico y sacos de tomates rojos y frescos conforman su puesto de venta en un esquina del mercado de la ciudad de Granada. Sus inicios fueron las ventas ambulantes en el mercado ganando su propio dinero su padre lo empezó a motivara que pusiera su puesto de ventas de verduras tuvo la oportunidad de conseguir un lugar fijo donde vender sus vegetales  medida que su negocio fue generando ingresos el compro un camioneta de segunda mano la cual utiliza para acarreo. El requiere el préstamo para comprar cebolla, tomates, chiltomas, pepinos, apio, repollo, remolacha, naranjas, yuca, papaya, sandia, melones. Pues el quiere tener variedad de todo tipo de frutas y vegetales para ofrecer y proveer a su clientes de buenos productos. Uno de sus planes es construir una pequeña bodega y hacer mas seguro su puesto.
texts.en: Miguel, is 29 years old. He is married and the father of three children, aged 8,7 and 3. He is a humble and simple merchant who sells fruits and vegetables with a plastic sheet for a roof to protect him from the sun. Two plastic crates and sacks of fresh red tomatoes make up his sales stand, at the corner of a market in the city of Granada. He started as a mobile vendor in the market, earning his own money. His father encouraged him to set up his own vegetable sales stand, and he had the opportunity to obtain a fixed place where he could sell his vegetables. As his business generated more income, he bought a small secondhand truck, which he uses to transport his products. He needs the loan to buy onions, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, celery, cabbage, beets, oranges, yuca, papayas, watermelon and cantaloupes. This is because he wants to have a variety of fruits and vegetables to offer his customers and to provide them with good products. One of his plans is to construct a small shop building to make his sales stand more secure.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, celery, cabbage, beets, oranges, yuca, papayas, watermelons and cantaloupes.

loans.name: Freddy Fernando

texts.es:
Freddy de 21 años, empezó a trabajar como comerciante desde muy pequeños a los 13 años, con esfuerzos y con la ayuda de Dios pudo salir adelante.

Trabaja todos los días, realiza su trabajo solo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su dificultad solo es la delincuencia. Está casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, y tiene un hijo de 9 meses quien es su propósito para seguir adelante con su trabajo.

Tiene muchas aspiracion con su ventas por eso quiere seguir vendiendo helados, ropa etc. Para mejorar sus ingresos el quiere comprar con el prestamo helados y ropa. Su meta es poder tener un negocio estable para sí poder darles un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Freddy is 21. He started to work as a small businessman from an early age, at 13. With hard work and God's help, he managed to get ahead. 

He works every day, and carries out his work on his own, from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 in the evening.  His only challenge is the crime problem. He is married, and his wife does the household chores. They have a nine month-old son who is the reason he keeps working.

He has many ambitions for his business. That's why he wants to continue selling ice cream, clothing, and other things. To improve his income, he wants to use the loan to buy ice cream and clothing. His goal is to have a steady business, so that he can provide his family with a good future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as ice cream and clothing.

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es: Ana Yanci de treinta y siete años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee un negocio de venta de ropa, camisetas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros últimamente se ha hecho de mas clientela, por lo tanto ha aumentado la demanda de su producto,  ya que es de muy buena calidad a precios bajos y con un servicio inigualable; Ana es una mujer enérgica totalmente dispuesta a salir adelante piensa que el secreto para llegar al triunfo es la constancia y la dedicación en su trabajo y es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar blusas, camisas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, etc. Ana Yanci tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle una vida plena a su familia.
texts.en: Ana Yanci, 37, lives with her common-law husband and children.  She has a clothes business and sells t-shirts, dresses, and trousers as well as other items.  Lately she has seen an increase in customers and therefore more demand for her products.  She offers good quality at low prices and her service is unequalled.  Ana is an energetic woman who is determined to get ahead.  She believes the secret to success is consistency and dedication to work, so she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL that will enable her to buy blouses, shirts, dresses, skirts, trousers, etc.  Ana Yanci is confident that this will  enable her to give her family a fullfilling lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, dresses, skirts and trousers.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has four children. Mercy is 51 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. Mercy has a gardening business and she's been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this work. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Recently, Mercy joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as an additional investment in her business. In the future, Mercy wants to make improvements to her house and to finished the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Mrs. Po, 22, lives in Takhmao town with her husband and young kid. She has worked in the farming business for many years. She typically grows rice and some kinds of vegetable crops, from which she is able to generate approximately $4.00 per day. Her husband always helps her manage the business. 

Mrs Po is taking out her second loan of KHR 2,000,000 from HKL to purchase vegetables and rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to put on her farmland. In the future, Mrs. Po wants to improve her business and expand to additional farmland for a higher rate of output.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Nadiha

texts.en:
Nahida is a 47-year-old housewife. She is a mother of six sons and daughters. Her husband has a shop for selling fruits and vegetables.

Nahida is a person who loves to make hand-made crafts. She makes decoration pieces at home, as shown in the photo (fruit shaped decoration pieces), and she also has a small business selling home products. 

She is hoping that one day she can expand her business and have her own shop selling crafts and home products, especially center pieces. In order to achieve her dream, she has applied for a loan today to buy more products with which she can make more ceramic craft items.

loans.use: To buy materials for making ceramic crafts.

loans.name: Anju

texts.en: Anju is 36 years-old .  She is Married and has 3 children aged 17, 12 amd 7.  In 1996, she established  her tailoring business business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys raw materials for her business.  In the future, Anju plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her business

loans.name: Husan

texts.ru: Хусан мужчина в возрасе 29 лет, он женат имеет 1 ребенка. В течении 6 лет,он разводит дома скот. У него есть 7 гектаров земли, где в сезонное время выращивает овощи. Хусана жена домохозяйка, но она помогает ему в работе и ухаживать за скотом. У него дома 2 коровы и теленок. Также на даче,он выращивает лук, помидоры и бахчевые культуры. Хусан большую часть скота содержит на даче так как там больше корма и травы. Настоящий кредит использует для покупки  скота.
texts.en: Husan is a 29-year-old man, he is married and has a child. For the past 6 years, he has been raising cattle at home. He has 7 hectares of land, where he cultivates vegetables during the growing season. Husan's wife takes care of the household, and also helps him look after the livestock he keeps at home - 2 cows and a calf. Furthermore, at his dacha Husan grows onions, tomatoes, and melons. This is where he also keeps most of his cattle, since there they have more food and grass. Husan will use this loan to buy additional cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Machinery Group

texts.en:
Machinery group was started in 2010.It is a very powerful group of VEP.The group entertains others during fuctions for a pay and also they rear rabbits for sale.
The group needs a loan of Kshs:495,000 to buy 165 cooking stove for sale.The group is determined to change life of those who are using three stone firewood jiko to use the improved cooking stove which is economical and for good health.
Monthly they will be ble to repay the loan issued at ease from the sales made from jikos and rabiits and also from income received after entertainment.

loans.use: To pay for cooking stove

loans.name: Brendah

texts.en:
Brendah is a 28-year-old married, honest and hardworking woman living in Kagadi, Uganda, with two children, aged 6 and 4 years; both attend school. She has been a town agent since 2013; she has a boutique and earns a salary from the electoral commission. 

She hopes to grow her boutique business, but she is challenged by delayed payments from her customers. Brendah is asking for a loan to buy clothes for her boutique for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her boutique for selling.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a hardworking married man with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Three of his children are school going. He used his previous loan to buy more manure and fertilizers for his farm.He is still majorly a crop farmer who supplements his earnings with a monthly salary. He does all this work to enable him pay school fees for his children. He loves to finish up his residential house but he is limited by pests and diseases that attack his crops.
He is requesting a loan to buy manure, fertilizers and pesticides to improve on his crops.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and pesticides to improve on his crops.

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en: Jordan H. has more than 20 years working experience in a scrap remaking company. He is 50 years old, married with two daughters. One of them lives in Germany now. Seven years ago he decided to start to do this business for him. So he found a paper scrap station. All used paper he reduced and started to produce napkins and toilet paper out of it. During the years the business is growing up and now Jordan has modern equipment for reducing paper. Because the increased capacity Jordan H. needs to buy a motor truck for load and unload activities. The loan amount is $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a motor truck

loans.name: Vilyet

texts.en:
Vilyet is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. He has had this business for 5 years and it allows him to support his family. 
Having borrowed $600 he bought medicines for his sheep.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 10 sheep.
Vilyet is 53 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a single female of 22 years old.  She lives in the small Samoan village of Moamoa.  Mary says that she wasn’t a very good student while in school.  And so rather than continue, she asked her mother if she could attend sewing courses.  She went to these courses for two and a half years.  And although she didn’t complete her full course, she felt comfortable that she had built up the skills and knowledge necessary to start her own sewing business.  She admits that since then she has learned a lot from experience.  She joined SPBD to get started and with her first loan, she purchased a sewing machine.  She is now requesting a second loan that she will use to buy materials for her sewing.  Mary’s ultimate goal is to become a professional tailor.

loans.use: Purchase new materials and tools for sewing.

loans.name: Habibulla

texts.en: Habibulla is forty-five years old, and lives in Kohna-Khachmaz village, located in the Khachmaz region. Habibulla is married and has three children. He owns his own orchard, where he currently grows fruits and vegetables. He would like a loan of $600 to expand the size of his orchard and to purchase medicines.

loans.use: to expand the area of his orchard and to buy  orchard medicines

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn O., 53, lives with her husband and seven children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling different types of beans and earns approximately $2.40 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works on a piece of farmland growing crops (vegetables, etc.) Two of her children are self-employed as construction workers; another is employed at a garment factory and the rest are students.

Mrs. Orn O. and her husband are humbly requesting a loan to purchase a well frame to enable them to produce wells for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a well frame  to enable them to produce wells

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en: Dativa is a 29-year-old mother of two and a resident of the Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam city. She has been running a restaurant in the area for close to three years. She is in need of U.S. $225 to help her buy more tables and chairs, so as to cater to the increasing number of customers.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant

loans.name: Tupaolo

texts.en: Tupaolo is from Sauano Fagaloa. She is 34 years old, married, and has children. Tupaolo’s husband does not have a good educational background and, therefore, does not have a good job. Since Tupaolo joined the programme, her husband has been helping her out with carving and designing handicrafts. The couple then sells the handicrafts to flea market owners and to hotels for tourists from overseas. Tupaolo is a hard-working lady and is looking forward to continuing earning income with the help of SPBD. She is one of the oldest members of the programme, and this is her second loan. She would like to borrow US$475 to buy a new filing machine and tools for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of a new filing machine and tools for a handicrafts business

loans.name: Juana Pilar

texts.en:
Juana has been part of the community bank Arco Iris for the past 12 years; currently she is the bank president. Juana mentioned that in her bank she has learned to be responsible, punctual and respectful, how to save, and how to educate her children. With her savings Juana has been able to educate her children, buy a piece of land, and improve her house.

Juana is 48 years old. She is married and has six children, the youngest of whom is six years old. She lives in the small town of Rancha. Juana travels to different markets in the region where she buys grains, cheeses, animals, and other products which she later sells in the Playa Grau market in Ayacucho. Furthermore, Juana, together with her husband, raises cattle.

Juana needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying corn, peas, wheat, quiN., cheese, roosters, guinea pigs, and pork.

Juana dreams of buying more land, building a house closer to the road, providing an education for her children, and having a bigger business.

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will be invested in buying corn, peas, wheat, quinoa, cheese, roosters, guinea pigs, and pork.

loans.name: Buziika South A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Esther Z.. She is currently operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase her working capital. Esther is 35 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Esther makes approximately UGX 31500 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business and cater to her family's needs. Esther has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 800000 in order to purchase more shop items and the loan was paid back on time.

Esther is joined in her small group by Mariam P., Regina N., Madina N., and Lukia N.. Mariam P. has a business selling clothes and wants to increase working capital. Regina N. is currently operates a clothing business and wants a loan to purchase a variety of clothes for sale. Madina N. operates a business of selling snacks and wants to buy a microwave machine for warming snacks. Lukia N. is currently operates a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To boost retail shop business

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Mrs. Maura is 43 years old and has lived in the city of La Paz for more than 20 years. She is one of the earliest customers of the institution, because she worked 32 sequences with the solidarity group yanapacunas with an impecable credit history. She is currently requesting her second individual loan.

Her family is comprised by 7 people, including the parents. Their eldest son is independent; their second daughter, even though an adult, still depends on her parents because she suffers from epilepsy; their three youngest children are still students. Her husband is a public servant, working in the municipal government of La Paz for which he receives a monthly salary which he invests in supporting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora tiene 43 años de edad con residencia de mas de 20 años en la ciudad de La Paz, es una de las clientes mas antiguas de la institución, ya que trabajó 32 secuencias con el grupo solidario yanapacunas con un historial crediticio impecable, actualmente solicita su segundo crédito individual.

su familia esta compuesta por 7 miembros incluido los padres de los cuales el hijo mayor ya es independiente, su segunda hija aunque ya es mayor de edad aún depende de sus padres debido a que padece de Epilepsia, y sus tres hijos menores aun son estudiantes. El esposo es Servidor pùblico, trabaja en el gobierno Municipal de La Paz por lo cual percibe un salario mensual que invierte en la manutención de su familia.

loans.use: Buying raw materials for production (COMPRA DE INSUMOS PARA SU PRODUCCION)

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi is 39 years old and is married with four children. She and her husband also take care of two other people, who are both 70 years old. Mwanamkasi is a shoe seller through a business she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $150 to buy more shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for her business.

loans.name: Khi Meak Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khi M. is the group leader of five members in the Sna Pich Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Khi M. is 37 years old and married with three children, two of whom are enrolling in school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Teth Suon, is a palm juice collector in the village and he usually gathers palm juice to make sugar palm and palm wine.

Mrs. Khi M. is a palm leaf sewer who combines palm leaves together to make roofing for people's houses. Aside from this activity, she is a hard-working farmer. Recently, she has been confronted with an obstacle because the field is more infertile. Mrs. Khi M. now needs to access a loan to buy more fertilizer to support her field.

loans.use: To access for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support her field.

loans.name: Anoroy

texts.en:
Anoroy M. was born in 1969 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 4 children. She has been engaged in the family livestock business for 10 years. She also works on a collective farm, but that is seasonal work. Mrs. M. takes care of the animals, does the milking and makes yarn. She sells sour-milk products at the local bazaar. In addition, she knits warm socks to sell.

Mrs. M. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 US for 6 months so she can buy a computerized yarn-making machine. Mrs. M. thanks KIVA for its useful work and wishes everyone the best.

loans.use: To buy a computerized yarn-making machine

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Mahmud H. is 26 years old. He is single for now and lives with his parents. Mahmud has a higher education and works as an economist at a construction firm. He has a car “Opel,” but the car’s owner is Mahmud’s father. Mahmud has saved up some money and with the help of a loan he would like to purchase a car. He has been dreaming about purchasing the car “Neksia” for a long time and has decided to turn to MicroInvest for a loan for the purchase.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хафизов Махмуд парень в возросте 26 лет пока не семейный, живет вместе с родителями. Махмуд имеет высшее образование , работает экономистом в строительной компании.В данное время у Махмуда есть автомашина марки "Опель", но её хозяином является его отец. Поэтому Махмуд поднакопив денег , хочет с помощью кредита прибавить и купить себе собственную автомашину.Он уже давно мечтает о автомашине марки "Нексия" для ее покупки он решил обратится за займом в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Personal loan to purchase car

loans.name: Mayak

texts.en: Mayak A. is a 19-year-old man who tends a food store. He started his business in the beginning of 2008 and right now the main thing he is selling is beverages. Mayak has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000 USD to purchase more food products as tea, sugar, cookies, candies, etc. This will help him to expand his business and gain more profit from it.

loans.use: to purchase more food products as tea, sugar, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Jovitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza Tanzania!

This is Jovitha B.. She is a married woman with three children between the ages of two and six. She established her grocery business in 2007. Currently, she is getting a monthly profit of $80. She works twelve hours a day, six days a week. Jovitha is requesting a loan for $450 to purchase additional stock of maize flour, soap, cooking oil, and biscuits. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so she can use it while in process of paying back her loan, a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of micro leasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of maize flour, soap, cooking oil, and biscuits.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven C., 47, is a housewife who lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works hard to prepare the food for the family members, while her husband is a construction foreman, making around US$5 each day. This couple has two children, one of whom is a car mechanic earning about US$3 per day. Ven C. would like to take out a loan to breed cows for sale, and also to repair her house.

loans.use: To breed cows.

loans.name: Haseena Fateh M.khan Group

texts.en:
Haseena baji, the wife of F. M. K., lives in Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the past 28 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is in the 9th standard grade. Her younger son is in the 3rd standard grade. Her eldest daughter is in the 7th standard grade, and her younger daughter is in the 5th standard grade. 

Haseena baji's husband has a scrap business and has been in this business for the past 5 years. Haseena baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (iron, wasted papers and plastic bottles) to expand her husband's scrap business. 

She is joined in her loan group by three other members. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell. Mahjabeen baji wants a loan to buy warm clothes to sell in the market. Razia baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Claude R.. He is 33 years old and married with 4 children and 3 adopted orphans of the 1994 Genocide.

He started his business in 2006, selling lubricants for trucks, cars and motorcycles. He has switched business to hardware, where he sells different building materials like cement, paints, nails, electric lights etc.

He is looking for a loan worth 515000 Frws to add more stock for his clients, since he is speculating on high sales in the Christmas season! He will be repaying his loan in 12 months.

loans.use: Increase his stock

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del Banco Comunal Muchuy Huaraqac que significa Abundancia en quechua.

Agustina es viuda, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Agustina tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García, en donde vende arveja, haba, tubérculos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Además Agustina tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde vende cereales variados.
Agustina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales variados.

Agustina sueña con seguir trabajando, estar siempre junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the communal bank Muchuy Huaraqac, which means abundance in Quechua. Agustina is widowed, 58 years old, has 6 children and has a stall in the Nery García market where she sells peas, beans, tubers, which she does everyday with the help of her daughter. Agustina also has a stall in the Playa Grau market where she sells various cereals. Agusinea needs a loan of 3,000 soles (US $975), money that will be invested in the purchase of various cereals. Agustina dreams of continuing to work, always with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Agustina needs a loan that will be invested in the purchase of various cereals

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run S. K., 38, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She grows and sells various kinds of vegetables at the market and is able to make US$6.00 every day in revenue. She grows vegetables on a plot of land at her home.

Her husband is a fisherman. He sells his catch to the market, and also provides some for the family. On average, he makes US$10.00 a day in revenue. This couple has two school-aged children. Mrs. Run is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport fish to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ally

texts.en: Ally M.  is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and business man . He is a carpentry man. He runs the business at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam.  He makes and sells different types of furniture to customers. Buguruni is a trading timber market center.  He need a loan of T.shs 1,000,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more business stocks

loans.name: Asociacion De Cristo Group

texts.en:
Asociacion D. Cristo is a group comprised of 15 people, all from the same area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic. Each member has already received a previous loan, and gotten a start on their own small business. This will actually be the third loan that each member receives, and each member has experienced success with their previous two loans. Many members didn't have any form of income before their first loan, so this is their opportunity to change their lives, and to have a more hopeful future.

Alicia P. is the chosen group representative, and it's obvious why because she is fun and outgoing. She is the mother of 4 children and lives with them and her husband. Before her first loan she didn't contribute any money to the family and had to rely completely on her husband. She felt useless and wanted to do more. She loves her children more than anything and knew that she needed to start making some money to help give them a better life. She then went to Esperanza International and took out her first loan. With the loan she started a small fruit and vegetable business in her area. She is a diligent worker and through time she was able to pay back all her loans and save some money.

Now she is hoping to receive her third loan, which will enable her to start selling a wider variety of fruits and vegetables. She is happy with the way her business is running and believes that she can continue to expand. She is now an important contributor to her family and feels that she can proviD. for her children. She dreams of putting all her children through college, and she is on the right path! For the first time in her life she is excited for the future and knows she is going to break the cycle of poverty. On behalf of Alicia and Esperanza International---- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Buy more products to sell

loans.name: Laura Nohemi

texts.es:
Laura inició el negocio porque anteriormente trabajo en una merceria y le gusto lo que ahi hacia, por lo que hace 5 años se decidio a emprender su propio negocio e instalo una papeleria en su casa, 
inicio con una copiadora, sacando copias, vendiendo lápices, libretas, productos basicos, por lo que le empezo a ir bien, y actualmente realizo adecuaciones a su domicilio para tener mejores instalaciones para sus clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $ que pagara en meses para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con su negocio ya que en un futuro quiere  vender  helados ya que la mayoria de sus clientes son estudiantes y cree que ahí puede tener una fuente de ingresos extra.
texts.en:
Laura began her business because she previously worked in a fabric store and liked the work. So, five years ago she decided to open her own business and started a stationery store in her home. She began by making copies with a photocopier and sold pencils, notebooks, and other common items. Her business did well, and she has since made renovations to her home to provide better facilities for her customers.

Laura is requesting a loan for 5,000 Mexican pesos, to be repaid in five months. With the loan, she will purchase merchandise to be able to continue expanding her business. In the future, she would like to sell ice cream, as the majority of her customers are students and she feels that this would be a good source of additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El señor Jorge Luís B. López , tiene la edad de 28 años , habita en las pilas Oriental ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , un varón de 16 años que estudia y trabaja y una adolescente de 12 años que solo estudia ; los planes hacia su familia es apoyarle a sus hijos para que puedan realizar una carrera profesional , don Jorge desde hace ocho años trabaja como agricultor , la mayor dificultad que se le presentan son las plagas , el inicio su actividad con sus propios esfuerzos y la oportunidad que le brindo nuestra institución para que logre una mejor producción . Con este segundo financiamiento lo va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para poder obtener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge Luis B. L. is 28 years old and lives in Pilas Oriental in the city of Masaya. Together with his wife, who works to help pay household expenses, they have two children, a 16-year-old boy who studies and works and a 12-year-old girl who is a full-time student. His goals for his children is to support them so that they may complete their studies leading to professional careers. Mr. B. has worked as a farmer for the past 8 years. The greatest obstacle for him are pests. He began his work with his own efforts and the help which our organization was able to offer led to better production. With this second loan he will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and raw materials to get a better harvest which he will be able to sell at a better market price.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and fertilizers.

loans.name: Joseph M.k

texts.en:
Joseph M.K. M. is a commercial driver in Elmina, Ghana. Joseph M.K has completed senior high school. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a seamstress.

Joseph M.K has been a commercial driver since 2008. He is responsible for paying bills. His loan will be used to buy car parts for his business. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and build more houses.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy purchase car parts for his business.

loans.name: Sivi

texts.es: Sivi tiene 42 años, es soltera, tiene tres hijos; Carlos de 21, Joel de 16 y Ruth de 11, de los cuales sólo vive con los dos últimos, ya que el primero ya se mantiene solo. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ropa, aprendió desde muy pequeña este arte de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a este oficio para mantener a su familia. Es así que hoy en día, ella también optó por dedicarse a lo mismo, junto a su hermana y a un par de señoras que la ayudan en su pequeño taller.  Su trabajo comienza cuando le hacen pedidos, entonces Sivi elabora la cantidad solicitada, que usualmente suele ser por cientos, para luego viajar a la ciudad de Tumbes, que es donde ella ofrece su mercadería, y con otra parte su hermana viaja a la frontera con Ecuador para vender en mayor cantidad, ya que ahí hay muy buena demanda de sus prendas. Para el futuro, Sivi espera tener una gran fábrica, donde tenga a muchas personas trabajando y así abastecer grandes pedidos de ropa. Este es el primer préstamo individual de Sivi con Microfinanzas PRISMA, y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, como lo fue anteriormente con su banco comunal. Invertirá el dinero que solicita en comprar material (telas, cierres, hilos, etc.) y así mejorar la producción de su taller encaminándose a la ampliación.
texts.en:
Sivi is 42 and single. She has three children; Carlos is 21, Joel is16, and Ruth is 11. She only lives with the last two since the first child is independent. For ten years she has been making and selling clothes. She learned to do this from her parents when she was very little. They worked in this business to take care of their family. She has chosen to do the same work together with her sister and a pair of ladies who help her in her small shop. Her work starts when orders are placed. Sivi then makes the ordered number of items, which is usually in the hundreds. She then travels to the city of Tumbes, which is where she sells her merchandise. Her sister travels to the border with Ecuador to sell in larger quantities since there is a big demand there for her clothes. In the future, Sivi hopes to have a big factory with a lot of people working and filling large clothing orders. This is her first individual loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She promises to be punctual with all of her payments, just like she was in the past with her community bank. She will use the loan to buy material (fabric, zippers, thread, etc.). That way she will improve her shop’s production on her way to expansion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her clothes making shop

loans.name: Djalolkhon

texts.en:
D. Djalolkhon is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Djalolkhon works in the central city market selling men’s clothing and shoes. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 4 years.

Djalolkhon likes to work for himself. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Today Djalolkhon would like to ask for a loan of 2500 Somoni to purchase new inventory. We believe Djalolkhon‘s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Djalolkhon’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new men's clothing to sell

loans.name: Fatmata Sankoh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Fatmata S., Ibrahim B., Memunatu K. and Lamrana S.. They named their group Fatmata S. group, after the group’s leader. These women are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, located in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, these entrepreneurs hope to be able to expand their businesses, make better profits and improve their current standard of living. 

Fatmata, the leader of this group, was born in Magburaka, located about 22 miles from Makeni. She is married to a farmer and together have six children. Of her children, several attend primary school and the remaining attend secondary school. Fatmata owns a shop in Makeni where she sells rice, provisions, biscuits, mints, cigarettes, drinks, water, etc. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for seven years now.

loans.use: To further invest in her business selling rice, provisions, biscuits, mints, cigarettes, drinks and water in order to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Kadriddin

texts.ru: Чабборов Кадриддин проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Кадриддин более 7 лет занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. У него есть постоянные клиенты. Но он иногда продает скот на рынке. Кредит просит для покупки скота.
texts.en:
Kadriddin C. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Kadriddin has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He feeds and sells livestock. He has loyal customers, but he sometimes sells livestock at a market. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Joyce Makandaga ’S Group

texts.en:
Joyce is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 49-year-old single mother of five children aged between 13 and 22 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a one-room house, where she is staying with two people. Joyce takes care of her sister. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala.

Joyce stays in Mulago Katanga, selling milk in one of Kampala's suburbs She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. Joyce sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Joyce sells mainly on a retail basis. She buys milk from Bwaise, where there is a milk depot. 

Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises and home. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. Joyce has been with MCDT for more than three years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerrycans of milk. Joyce aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise. 

.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma , 30 years old is  divorced mother of two children who both attend school. She had a business selling bread and cakes two years ago but found that the business was not expanding, so she now brews and sells alcohol locally.  In order to expand the business, she is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing materials including yeast and sugar.

She looks forward to eventually building a bar from the extra profits realized from her loan.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as  measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and yeast for brewing

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget S. lives in Chek Village in Kandal Province. She sells vegetables in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Heang Sokchea, is a farmer who cultivates rice on land he owns. He faces difficulties on his farm, because he does not have much money to spend on his rice paddy. Thus, Mrs. Nget S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline to fuel a water pump for the rice field. She is 40 years old and the mother of four children. Three of the children are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest child is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and gasoline to fuel a water pump for the rice field

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Clarisa es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Clarisa es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Clarisa vive en el distrito de Acosvinchos, en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Clarisa necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Clarisa son progresar y que su hijo sea profesional.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azúcar.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is the married mother of two children. Her women’s clothing business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past ten years that she’s been in business. In a typical month she makes about $200 in profit from the business.

Saodat is hard-working, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. She has requested a loan of $800 USD to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new inventory for her business

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona G. is from the village of Sugarland, Valencia City. She is 31 years old and single. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing clothing to local community members. Chona has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lizzette

texts.es:
La señora vive en casa de sus familiares en la c/ Gregoria Apaza  zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz es comerciante y trabaja con abarrotes (vende azucar, arroz, harina y otros) y refrescos.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar más productos y tratar de mejorar sus costos para obtener un mejor margen de ganancia.  

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2008 y tiene un buen historial de pagos..
texts.en:
This lady lives in her family’s house, which is on the Gregoria Apaza block in the Achachicala region of the city of La Paz. She is a business woman, and she works with groceries (she sells sugar, rice, flour, and others) and soft drinks. The loan she is asking for is to buy more products and to try to improve her costs so that she can have a better margin of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, flour, sugar, soft drinks and others for her retail sales

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is only 21 years old. She lives together with her family in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela. Imelda is married to Leo who is designated as a Counselor in their village. They are blessed with a daughter who is now four years old. The couple dreams of a good future for their child. They hope to send her to college and have her finish her courses someday. 

Imelda wants to help her husband provide for the needs of their child. She started raising hogs two years ago and she hopes that her livestock business will be maintained and grow further. She hopes for a loan of PHP4,000 as her additional capital to purchase additional hogs to raise. The loan could also help her purchase a supply of feed for her pigs. She hopes that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: To buy additional hogs and feed for her piggery

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol N. is from the town of Alimanao Peñablanca,Cagayan. She is 31 years old. Mirasol is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Mirasol is starting a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 600 PHP a day for these activities.

In 2008, Mirasol joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mirasol from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure supplies

loans.name: Frans

texts.es: Frans de 18 años, es un joven trabajador que vive en casa de sus padres y tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida. Es así que vale de su juventud para trabajar muy duro y ayudar a sus padres, aportando en los gastos de su hogar. Desde ese momento sale todos los días a recolectar leche en el poblado de Taraco (Distrito de la provincia de Huancane), y con ello elabora deliciosos quesos, que luego son llevados a otros distritos de la ciudad de Puno para su venta. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede manejar sus horarios para continuar con sus estudios, es así que lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad, siendo la parte más ardua de su labor en conseguir leche de calidad para elaborar sus quesos, ya que como única fuente de ingreso debe esmerarse en ofrecer a sus cliente el mejor queso para así poder ganar más y ayudar a sus padres en la economía de su casa. Este es el primer préstamo de Frans con MFP y tiene el firme compromiso de no fallar en sus pagos y ser responsable con los demás miembros de su banco comunal. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más leche para elaborar más quesos.
texts.en:
Frans is a young worker of 18 who lives at home with his parents and has great dreams to get ahead in life. He works very hard and his youth helps him help his parents with the household expenses.. Every day he goes out to collect milk from the village of Taraco (in the Huancane District), and with it he makes delicious cheese. He then takes the cheese to other districts in the city of Puno to sell. What he likes most about his work is that he can manage his schedule to continue with his studies. He’s been doing this for 3 years, but the most arduous part of the work is to get the quality of milk that he needs to make his cheese. This is his only source of income and he goes to a lot of trouble to be able to offer his customers the best cheese so that he can earn more and help his parents with expenses of the house.
