This is Frans’s first loan with MFP and he is determined not to miss any payments and to be responsible with the other members of the communal bank. With these five hundred new sols that he is requesting, he will buy more milk to make more cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more milk to make cheese

loans.name: Ely

texts.en:
Ely M. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Ely is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Ely owns & operates a retail store where she buys and sells coconut shells for coconut shell charcoal to local community members. Ely has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ely is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel E. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Richel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Richel raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables, such as beans ("batong"), sweet potatoes ("camote taps") "kangkong", okra, etc., in the local community. Richel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2004, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. Richel is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 24th loan taken out by Richel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motorcylce taxi

loans.name: Çhanthy

texts.en: Mrs. Çhanthy N. is a 23-year-old married woman who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and grocery seller who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Boeun Nov, is a motorcycle taxi driver. Mrs. Çhanthy N. is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan from AMK/Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for her husband's business. She will use the balance of the loan to buy groceries to expand her business. This loan will help increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband's business and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks in bulk

loans.name: Victor Moises

texts.es:
Víctor, es soltero tiene 2 hijas una de las cuales se encuentra en edad escolar y la 
otra se encuentra preparándose en una academia preuniversitaria, el cliente posee una 
carpintería la cual la inicio hace algunos años atrás, teniendo experiencia y un buen 
numero de clientes , el realiza buenos trabajos con buenos acabados y de buena 
calidad, sus clientes retornan siempre por sus servicios, el sueño de Víctor es que 
sus dos hijas puedan tener una buena educación y así puedan enfrentar el futuro, por   
este motivo es que el destina todos los ingresos para este fin. Solicita el crédito 
para la compra de mercadería y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Victor is single and has two daughters, one who is school-aged, and the other is in academy preparing for college. He has a carpentry business that he started a few years ago. He is experienced and has a good number of customers. He does good work with nice finishing and high quality. His customers always return for his services. Victor's dream is that his two daughters receive a good education and be prepared for the future. For this reason, all of his income goes towards this goal. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of merchandise, so that he can increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Mercaderia

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco H. Rivera tiene 41 años el vive en la comunidad de Viloma de la provincia de Sipe Sipe de la ciudad de Cochabamba a 20 kilómetros de la ciudad él se dedica a la agricultura como y su esposa a la producción de leche al modulo de Viloma.

El trabaja desde muy jovencito está acostumbrado al trabajo de campo él fue abandonado no se crio con sus padres solo con su abuela quien estuvo con él hace tres años que murió y el siente todavía el dolor y la falta de su abuela que era su  madre ya que gracias a ella es un hombre responsable trabajador y dedicado a su familia está casado tiene tres hijos pequeños a los cuales le enseña a ser personas de bien el dice que jamás abandonaría sus hijos ni a su esposa él trabaja de lo que pueda para no hacer faltar ni un pan a sus hijos el empieza en la mañana a la colaboración del ordeño de las vacas porque tiene que entregar en la mañana y en la tarde después va a cortar alfa y después se va al trabajo de sus terrenos o bien va a trabajar como albañil.

El requiere el crédito para la adquisición de una moto cultora para poder realizar su trabajo más liviano para traer el forraje  para las vacas y hacerlo en el menor tiempo posible y de esa manera poder dedicarle un tiempito a sus hijos y con su esposa ya que empiezan a trabajar muy temprano y el nos lo ve a sus hijos pero él trabaja para que tengan un futuro mejor el sueña con que sus hijos terminen la universidad  que tengan una profesión y sean mejor que él y el dice que siente rabia por el abandono de sus padres pero da gracias a Dios por haberse criado con su abuela que era la mejor esa es la historia de Francisco.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco H. Rivera is 41 years old and lives in the community of Viloma in the province of Sipe Sipe within the city of Cochabamba. It is about 20 kilometers to the city. He works as a farmer, and his wife works in milk production. He has worked in the field since he was very young. He grew up without his parents and was raised by his grandmother, who passed away three years ago. He still misses her because she was like his mother and thanks to her he learned how to be a responsible, hard-working man. He is dedicated to his family; he is married with three small children, who he teaches to be good people. He would never leave his children or his wife. He works as hard as he can so that they do not lack for food. He starts his day in the morning helping his wife milk the cows and after that he cuts alfalfa and works his land. Occasionally he works as a mason too. He needs a the loan to purchase farm machinery which will make his work much easier. He will be able to deliver feed for the cows in much less time and thus have more time to spend with his children and wife because he has to start work very early. He works so that his children can have a better future and he dreams of seeing his children finishing university, working as professionals, and having a better life than he has. His abandonment by his parents still bothers him, but he thanks God for his grandmother because she was the best thing that happened in his life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of farm machinery

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señorita Lidia H. V. tiene 28 años es soltera, vive en la zona de la Maica Central de la Provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.Lidia ha estudiado para farmacéutica y trabaja en Omereque una Localidad ubicada al Sur del departamento de Cochabamba. Ella trabaja en el Centro de Salud de Omereque, en atención de la Farmacia del Centro de Salud de Omereque.

Lidia viaja hasta Omerque cada 2 semanas y viene a visitar a madre viuda a La zona de La Maica pues es la hija menor, y la única que le acompaña en su casa, Lidia ya puede ganar su propio sueldo, aunque en Bolivia los sueldos al sector salud no son muy bien reconocidos, y más  aun a Lidia, que solo está encargada de la atención de la farmacia del Centro de Salud del Pueblo, además de eso ella debe pagar un alquiler, porque no cuenta con propiedad en Omereque, ese es el estilo de vida que lleva Lidia, a veces cuando debe viajar por emergencia a visitar a su madre no tiene le alcanza sus sueldo, pero es el sacrificio que debe pasar por cumplir los sueños de su madre de poder desenvolverse como Farmacéutico, Lidia lleva casi dos años trabajando así, su deseo que es que pueda llevarse a su mamá hasta Omereque y allá vivirían las dos, pero como no tiene suficientes ingresos para poder mantener a su mamá mas. La madre de Lidia ha trabajado toda su vida en la lechería pero ahora se encuentra cansada además que tiene una edad muy avanzada, y sufre de reumatismo, no podrá dedicarse por mucho tiempo a esta actividad.

Lidia ha solicitado el crédito para poder iniciar su negocio de Farmacéutico en Omereque,  ella ha podido ver que en esa pequeña localidad la población necesita de una Farmacia que pueda atender en los horarios cuando el Centro de Salud está cerrado, así con esos ingresos más podrá con el tiempo cumplir sus deseos de llevar a su madre a vivir con ella, y no estar tan separadas, además podrá cuidar a su mamá.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia H. V. is 28 years old, single, and lives in the Maica Central region of the Cercado province, in the department of Cochabamba. She has studied to be a pharmacist and works in the health center of Omereque, located in the southern region of Cochabamba. Lidia travels to Omereque every two weeks and goes to visit her mother in the region of La Maica, since she is the youngest daughter and the only one who accompanies her at home. She can already earn her own salary, although in Bolivia the salaries in the health sector are not very high. Furthermore, Lidia is only in charge of the health center's pharmacy, and she must pay rent since she doesn't own property in Omereque. Occasionally, when she has to make an emergency visit to her mother, she cannot afford to travel. However, this is the sacrifice she must make to fulfill her mother's dream of seeing her become a pharmacist. She has been working like this for almost two years, and her wish is to take her mother to Omereque so they can live there together. However, currently she does not earn enough income to support her mother, who has worked her whole life in a creamery but now finds herself worn out and older in age. Also, she suffers from rheumatism and will not be able to carry on this activity much longer. Lidia has requested this loan to be able to start up a pharmaceutical business in Omereque. She has been able to see in this small town that the population needs a pharmacy that can attend to them during the hours when the health center is closed. Also, with this income she will be able to fulfill her desire to live together with her mother and also care for her.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pharmaceuticals for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a radiator for his vehicle

loans.name: Issatou

texts.fr: Issatou D. est une femme de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis le 22 janvier 2003, elle a capitalisé une expérience de 7 ans avec le crédit et n'a jamais eu de difficulté de remboursement, au contraire elle vient souvent au secours aux membres confrontés à certains problème de cet ordre. Elle est restauratrice et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant plus de provisions afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants pour la couverture alimentaire, sanitaire et scolaire.
texts.en:
Issatou D. is a 38 years old woman, she is married and a mother responsible for five children. She has been a member of a “Banc Villageois” since January 22, 2003. She has accumulated seven years of experience in borrowing and has never had difficulties to reimburse, in fact it is the opposite she often comes to the help of members who face that kind of problems. She does catering and her new loan will enable her to strengthen her activity by buying more supplies in order to better meet her customers’ demand. Her goal is to take care of her children financially with regards to food, health care and schooling.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To continue her catering activity

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan Miguel tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Cucungará, una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Cura Mori, un distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre. Se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se gana la vida desde hace seis años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, el suele criar ganado ovino y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

Adicionalmente también trabaja preparando y vendiendo chicha en su domicilio. La chicha es una bebida típica del país elaborada a base de harina de maíz. Se consume desde tiempos ancestrales, actualmente es consumida por los habitantes de zonas rurales en celebraciones y antes de empezar sus faenas, ya que creen que les da fuerza y vigor. Juan Miguel prepara esta bebida tres veces por semana y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos.

Juan Miguel desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y venderlos a un mejor precio, asimismo desea adquirir insumos para seguir preparando chicha. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.

Juan Miguel es un joven honesto y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es dar lo mejor de si para lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel, age 27, is single and does not have children. He lives with his family in the Cucungará sector. This is an urban zone in the area outlying the Cura Mori district. The district belongs to the Piura province in the region of the same name. It is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For six years he has made his living raising and selling small animals that are located in the back part of his house. He usually raises sheep. When they have grown enough he sells them to the businessmen who always visit the area where he lives. He also works preparing and selling “chicha” in his home. “Chicha” is a drink typical to the country. It is made from a base of corn flour. It has been consumed since ancestral times. It is currently consumed by the inhabitants of rural zones during celebrations and before starting their work. They believe that it gives them strength and vigor. Juan Miguel prepares this drink three times a week, and he sells it to his neighbors. Juan Miguel wants to get balanced feel to improve the food for his animals and sell them for a better price. He also wants to get supplies to continue making chicha. In order to achieve his objected he has requested, for the first time, a loan for 800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Juan Miguel is an honest and hard-working young man. His greatest wish is to give the best of himself so that his family will have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced feed in order to improve raising animals to sell

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: M. Byambasuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in own small house. Her son, Ganbayar, is 13 years old and attends a local secondary school. During the day, Baymbasuren operates a restroom renting business at a local market called Shonkhor Plaza. She is serving the many costumers in this market. Amarjargal has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. Every day she takes care to clean her restrooms. She works hard to make her costumers comfortable when they use her restrooms. She also likes that her business is not seasonal and that throughout the year she earns the same amount of profit. Her husband, Davaasuren is a sanitary engineering and helps his wife’s business with any sanitary problems. Bayambasuren is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase construction material. Because their house is very small, she is planning to built a bigger house.

loans.use: To purchase construction material to built a house

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P., age 38, and she is a villager who lives in Prey Preal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Bros Soung is a rice wine maker and also helps his wife on the farm. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase income to improve the family, Mrs. Mom P. decided to ask for a loan to buy six piglets for breeding and pig food. This couple has four children, who all are students and also support their parents businesses. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy six piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Agé de 39 ans, cet homme est célibataire et enseignant de profession. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, il voudrait implanter un moulin pour son exploitation.
Il s’agit d’un moulin déjà installé qu’il envisage acheter avec le crédit solliciter, destiné à moudre les céréales spécialement le maïs.
Il espère grâce à ce nouveau crédit accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
This 39-year old man is single and a teacher by profession. In order to diversify his income sources, he would like to open up and operate a mill. The mill in question is already in place and he is planning to buy it with the loan he has requested; it will be used to grind cereals, and in particular corn. Thanks to this new loan he is hoping to improve his profit margin.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a mill

loans.name: Edith Maria

texts.es:
Edith de 60 años,  ella tiene un salón de belleza en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por su pobreza. 

Tiene 25 años trabajando como estilista en su propio salón de belleza, aprendió en cursos y por la motivación de mantener a su hijo ya que esta separada de su esposo, trabaja todos los días haciendo cortes de cabello, tinturados, manicura, pedicura. 

Ella quiere mejorar su salón de belleza por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques y pinturas. En el futuro quiere mejorar su local para tener empleados a su cargo y ubicar un spa en su salón.
texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Edith has a beauty salon in the front part of her house. She lives in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Guayaquil, an area characterized by its poverty. She has worked for 25 years as a stylist in her own beauty salon. She learned this work from classes and because she needed to support her son. She is separated from her husband. She works every day cutting and coloring hair and giving manicures and pedicures. To improve her salon, she will use this loan to buy cement, cement blocks, and paint. In the future, she would like to have employees and have a spa in her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, cement blocks, and paint

loans.name: Barrio Loco Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Barrio Loco se encuentra integrado por Clara Isabel García Z. de 32 años, Claudia Verónica E. R. de 34 años y Carlos Antonio Hernández F. de 27 años. Clara, quien es la coordinadora, se dedica a la venta de productos AVON y de ropa nueva y usada 3 días a la semana, ella vende ambulante pero ya tiene una ruta marcada la cual recorre en cada ocasión con pequeños cambios de una o dos cuadras para captar nuevos clientes. Ella inició hace apenas medio año a dedicarse a esto; antes era ama de casa pero por la situación económica decidió buscar trabajo en la zona franca y estuvo ahí por casi un año. Esta joven mujer de 32 años recibe ayuda de su hija mayor de 15 años en sus actividades comerciales y su meta es ver triunfadores a sus 5 hijos.

Claudia, vende productos ESKIMO en su casa de habitación, así mismo vende perfumes los cuales muchas veces son encargados. Carlos, es albañil y también vende productos ESKIMO en su casa, así mismo en su hogar vende carnes. Este es el ejemplo de tres personas luchadoras que buscan distintas actividades económicas para lograr llevar una mejor calidad de vida a sus respectivos hogares.
texts.en:
Clara Isabel García Z., 32, Claudia Verónica E. R., 34, and Carlos Antonio Hernández F., 27, are the members of “Barrio Loco” (Crazy Neighborhood) communal bank. Clara, group Coordinator, sells AVON products and new and used clothing three days a week. She has a set route that she covers each time with small, one or two block detours, to get new customers. She just started half a year ago; she used to be a housewife but due to the economic situation she decided to find work in the free zone and was there for almost a year. This young 32-year-old gets help with her activities from her 15-year-old daughter. Her goal is to see her five children succeed. Claudia sells ESKIMO products from home; she also sells perfumes that are sometimes ordered from her. Carlos is a bricklayer and also sells ESKIMO products from home where he also sells meats. These are three examples of tenacious people who seek different economic activities to attain a better quality of life for their respective homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Abekundire Women's, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
In Ibanda town there is a determined lady named K. Betty aged 32 years. She belongs to Abekundire women's group. She is a go-getter businesswoman who has a general merchandise retail shop. This stickler of hard work and married mother of three children has basked in the career graces of her business for over 12 years. With this experience behind her, she has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her business.
 
In a month, her business generates a profit of 480,000 Ugandan shillings. This to all intents and purposes is a low figure. What has played into her hands as she operates her business has been her exceptional customer relationship skills. Now she is taking a long view with an aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will come in significantly handy in helping her buy more stock and get into full control over her business. Currently she sells small household items.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for resale

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela A. is a single woman who lives in  Brgy. Lipayo, Dauin, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures, a general store and a house rental business. Adela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to achieve something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use to restock her general store so that she may continue to save up for the future expansion of her businesses. Adela A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Restock store

loans.name: Makun's Group

texts.en: The situation with social security in our country (Kyrgyzstan) is unfortunately very sad. Senior citizens have to worry about their financial condition, while as a matter of principle, they should have a quiet, carefree life. Such professions as a teacher, an engineer and a doctor were considered the most prestigious ones. But nowadays, the salary of teachers is so miserable that most of them have to start a business here or leave for another country to work at a worthy job. This story is about a teacher and a retiree, who happen to fight for a convenient life regardless of their degree and age. Makun M. is a 58-year-old retiree. She’s the leader of this group. She’s a resident of Tokmok and after the death of her husband, she was left alone with her son. Unfortunately the amount of her pension is too small for giving her son a quality education. So Makun had to go into business. Four years ago, she took a loan to get her poultry-keeping business started. She became experienced in taking care of animals and decided to go on to the next level. She hopes to succeed in getting this loan and spend it on broadening her poultry business and purchasing a calf and hay. If this brings her much income, she would like to get a cow also and start a dairy business. Zeinep Y., 24, is a young entrepreneur. She is busy with selling vegetables and fruits at the market. So after gaining this loan, she plans to increase the commodity circulation of her business. Rahima B., 50, has one 20-year-old daughter. Rahima is a dispatcher in the bus terminal of Tokmok. After a while, she decided that she could run a business at the same time. She bought livestock and gave it to her brother for breeding. Rahima applied to this loan for purchasing a calf and gaining as much profit from it as possible. Raliya Y., 47, is a teacher in high school. Raliya’s husband is a welder and they are the proud parents of five children. She lives by the bus terminal and started a business in the market nearby. This loan she plans to spend on increasing her commodity circulation and opening a second small shop. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie T. is from Santiago St., San Jose, Antique, Philippines. She is 46 years old, married to Alberto T. and they are blessed with 3 Children.

Marjorie is a mother who dream fora bright future for their children. Her eldest child is already 22 years old and a graduate of Marine Engineering. The second child is a first year college student, while the youngest is in fourth year high school. She is very thankful to ASHI and its partner because one of her childing is already working as a seaman.

Marjorie is also one of the oldest and active members of ASHI ASB. Through her diligence in business, she earns an income which can sustain the basic needs of the family and educational allowance of her child who is presently taking a specialized course. She believes that, one way of getting out of poverty is through education. That is why she does everything as she can in order to send her children in school with which they will earn a degree and achieve  their dreams.

She wishes to apply for her next loan of  Php.40, 000.00.  This amount will purchase some farm supplies and provide additional capital for hog fattening business. This loan will be a great help in meeting the needs of her family, especially the educational allowance of her children.

She wants to put up a piggery project so that they will become financially stable someday. Her greatest dream is that through the help of ASHI and KIVA, all of her children will finished their studies in college.

loans.use: Hog Fattening and Farming

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma T. is a married woman who lives in Gilside, Brgy. Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a vegetable-selling business, a rice-selling business, and a general store. Her husband, Erwin T., who is 42 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 12 and 13 years old.

Elma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of 18 prior loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan in the amount of 22,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, thereby improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP ($425), which she intends to use to buy vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and her children's education. Elma T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon -- a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to assist the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join the team.

loans.use: To further expand one of her businesses by purchasing additional vegetables

loans.name: Suvd

texts.en:
Suvd R. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kharhorin, ancient Mongolian empire's capital. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son attends a local secondary school. 

Suvd and her husband operate a tourist camp business in their town. Since 2001, Suvd and her husband have worked as translators and guides and have gained a great deal of experience. After years of hard work, they were able to open their own guest house, called Suvd, and provide small tours to show Mongolia's natural beauty to travelers.  The couple owns 6 gers in their tour camp where travelers stay and rest. They do not have their own car, so they rent cars to show tourists around. 

Suvd is a very hardworking and clever woman.  She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car for their business, so that they can transport their customers through the beautiful landscape.

loans.use: To purchase a car

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
This is Remedios D., a 54-year-old resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She has an offspring, a young adult who is already working and managing the household while helping her with the business. By the grace of God, Remedios managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Remedios operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store retailing groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a Php23,000 loan to buy more quantities of products such as groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Remedios hopes that her business will grow and continue to be successful. She also prays that her family will be all right again. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, each fellowship group gathers every week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Four members who are living in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo Province, comprise this group loan. Mrs. Kong P., the group leader, has been selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards.

She and her husband, Mr. Hin Horm, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land upon which they grow rice to sell to support their family; Kong also breeds pigs at her home. She has four children, three of whom are students while the other one wants to go to Thailand to find work. Because she does not have the money to support her child's trip, Kong is seeking a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To support her child's trip to Thailand to find a job

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.en:
Nurzhamal E. was born in Republic of Tadjikistan. Her low-income family with six children earned their living through agriculture and, from early childhood, she helped her parents in this household and looked after her younger siblings. Nurzhamal got married at the age of 19 and gave birth to six children. 

In 1993, Nurzhamal’s family decided to move to Kyrgyzstan, to Partsyezd Village, where they bought a house with small plot of homestead land. They used it to grow different sorts of vegetables, which became their main source of income. As time passed by, Nurzhamal started to work as a cleaner and her husband became the teacher at the local school. After her older children got married and left their parents’ house, Nurzhamal move with her family to Voznesenovka Village, where her husband found a job at the juvenile colony located near the village. 

To support her husband and earn additional income for her children, Nurzhamal started her cattle breeding business with initial capital of 2,000 KGS. She worked hard and managed to maintain a farm with six milk cows and three bull calves. Today, she earns about 5,000 KGS each month by selling milk and meat. 

To develop her farm, Nurzhamal has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cows and sheep. It will allow her to build a huge barn so she can maintain her cattle well. In the future, she dreams of buying a minivan for her family.


Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mr. Daim Norith Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 15 people who live in Kruos village in TaK. province. 

Mr. Daim N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. They will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to support their families. 

Mr. Daim N. owns a rice mill in the local village and he is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support his family.

His wife, Mrs. Yorm Net, is a weaver who is able to earn some money to support her family, too. 

They have  three children, one of whom is a weaver, one is employed in a garment factory, and the other is a student.

Currently, Mr. Daim N. wants to breed a cow, yet his savings money is not enough to buy one. So Mr. Daim N. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene 48 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Narcisa nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de artesanía de tipo bisutería, ella tiene un pequeño taller  en su domicilio, ella sale a vender sus productos  en la plaza principal de la ciudad de Calca, ella es una persona amigable y colaboradora y por eso pertenece Narcisa al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales para seguir haciendo sus collares y aretes. Ya son 9 años que se dedica a la venta de artesanía y le ha ido muy bien. 
     
Narcisa se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Narcisa, 48, has three children and lives in the city of Pisaq in Calca province, Cusco department, Perú.

She tells us that she sells crafts of the costume jewelry type.  She has a small workshop at home and goes out to sell her wares in Calca’s main square.  She is a friendly, cooperative person so she belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Mosoq Ñusta” communal bank.  She needs the loan to buy more materials to continue making her necklaces and earrings.  She’s been selling crafts for 9 years and she has done very well.

Narcisa is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy more materials to continue making her necklaces and earrings.

loans.name: Leyla Vicenta

texts.es: Este Cliente es originario de telica, casada con 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio de la misma localidad, ella labora en el instituto señor de Esquipulas de la misma localidad, desempeñándose como Maestro de Secundaria con 22 años de Laborar en esa Area, siendo cliente de la empresa desde el año 2003 siendo fiel y actualmente tiene financiamiento activo, los cuales les han venido ayudar a mejorar su condición y Nivel de vida, ya que la necesidad actual es el mejoramiento del techo de su vivienda ya que se aproxima la temporada de invierno y quiere tenerlo listo antes de esa fecha.
texts.en: She is originally from Telica, she is married, and she has 2 children who go to school in their neighborhood. She works in the Senor de Esquipulas institution which is located in their neighborhood, working as a secondary school teacher. She has 22 years in this field of work. Having been a loyal client of this organization since 2003 she currently has an active loan. The loans have been a create help in improving her living conditions and her quality of life. Her current need is to improve the roof of her house especially because winter is approaching and she wants to have it ready before that time.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, beams, steeel, cement, construction blocks and paint

loans.name: Estrella's Group

texts.en:
Estrella M. is a 52-year-old woman from the village of Sipaloc, Sibutad. Estrella is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). While both members of the group would receive an individual loan, they would be collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if one of them is delinquent or defaults.

Estrella is married and has two adult-age children. To earn a living, Estrella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. Specifically, she raises hogs to sell. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for many years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Estrella joined PMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to improve her standard of living. Recently, Estrella successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase feed for her hogs. Estrella is now requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to build pig pens. Notably, this loan would be the seventh loan taken out by Estrella from PMPC.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To build pig pens

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya T. is 53 years old and lives with her husband in the Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. They have an average standard of living. 

All her children got married and they live on their own. Her husband drives a truck and operates a delivery service. 

She began retail trading of food and grocery in 2003. She rents a stall at a local market for her business and her daily net income is about 100,000 MNT. Her current working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. 

Sarantuya is a hardworking and polite person. She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more grocery products from Ulaanbaatar for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente ubicada en el Distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
Maura se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y aves de corral. Ella tiene un corral y una granja apropiada para esta crianza. También cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona y tiene 5 años desarrollando esta actividad. Los animales cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los vende a sus vecinos y/o a los comerciantes que visitan la zona.  Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar los gastos de su familia.
Maura desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, con la finalidad de que alcancen el tamaño y peso apropiado en menos tiempo y poder venderlos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maura is 49 years old.  She has a common-law marriage and three children.  She lives with her partner in her own home which is located in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in Piura region, four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Maura's business is raising pigs and poultry.  She has a farmyard and farm where she raises her animals.  She has an established customer base in her area and has been in business for five years.  When her animals have reached an ideal size and weight, she sells them to her neighbors and / or the traders who visit her area.  She uses the income from her business to cover her family's expenses.

Maura would like to buy balanced feed for her animals so that they reach a suitable size and weight in less time and she can sell them.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny K. is 59 years old, married, and has three children, two are married and live outside the family home. She and her husband are weavers.  The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Ny is requesting a loan of $700, which she will use to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to fill up the land around her house.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to fill up the land around her house

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Kamoki, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Chajoki. She moved here 20 years ago. 

She is a housewife who stays at her home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very caring person and does her responsibilities very well. 
Her husband has a dairy business. He sells milk to his community clients and earns a good profit every month. Razia is the mother of four sons. Her eldest son has a shop selling milk and the second son sells goats and sheep to butchers. Her third son is 18 years old and stays at home. The youngest son is studying in class 4th. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo, which will help him increase the milk production and make more profits. He has been doing this business for the past 20 years and Razia hopes that another buffalo will prove beneficial for his dairy business.


Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells sugar and groundnuts. She is 32 years old, married, and has 6 children. None of her children goes to school.

Mary borrowed a loan to stock more sugar and groundnuts to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more sugar and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta buys fish from the cold store, comes home and fries them for resale at Elmina a fishing community in Cape Coast. Atta has received a junior high education. She is married and has one child.  Her husband is a carpenter. 

Atta has been selling fish for 3 years. She assists her husband in the payment of utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more  fresh fish for sale.  She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is married with three children, and all go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. She operates a beauty salon and works six days a week. She has been in business for the last seven years. She operates on a retail basis only. Josephine has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more braids, cream relaxers and oils. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of creams and braids. She resides in a rented house where her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 25 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a married lady and a mother of one school-age child.

Janeth has a retail store at home where she sells canned goods, biscuits, coffee, milk, sweets and baked goods. She has been doing this for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to purchase stocks of soft drinks to sell.

Janeth has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Janeth hopes to renovate her store building and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ines María

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Inés, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos todos mayores de edad uno de ellos que es soltero  aun vive con ella. Su esposo está un poco enfermo y no puede trabajar.

Ella para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a ganarse la vida de forma honesta y en algo que le gusta, tiene a su cargo el bar de una escuela en Rocafuerte, aquí ella vende jugos naturales, frutas y bocadillos pero preparados sanamente para que los niños tengan un buen crecimiento, además ella prepara comida para los maestros y ciertos alumnos que almuerzan en el plantel. Trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8h00 hasta las 14h00, nos cuenta que lleva 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que empezó con su primer crédito.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para elaborar los alimentos y frutas. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran local en el centro.
texts.en:
The members of the “Rocafuerte” communal bank get together every two weeks in the Rocafuerte settlement.  This area is known all around the country for the delicious sweets prepared by the local people.

Here we meet 53 year old Inés.  She is married and has three adult children.  One of her sons is single and still lives with her.  Her husband is a bit sick and can’t work.

In order to get her family ahead, she earns an honest living doing something she enjoys, running the juice bar at one of the Rocafuerte schools.  She sells natural juices, fruits, and healthy snacks so that the children will grow well.  She also prepares food for some of the teachers and certain students who eat lunch there.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8:00am to 2:00pm and tells us that she’s been doing this for four years and that she began with her first loan.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fruits and ingredients that she will use to prepare the food.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for four years and she enjoys it because of the benefits she receives from the institution.

She hopes to someday have a major point of sale in the city center.

loans.use: to buy fruits and ingredients.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a hardworking 38-year-old businessman, is married and blessed with two children who attend school. Previously a charcoal-seller, he now offers video-shooting services to make a living. Within the next five years, David wants to double his business volume, and his dream is to transform his business into a firm.

Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to develop his business, and is now requesting a loan of 11500 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Serafin

texts.es: Serafin, tiene la edad 45 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos. El pretende con el crédito invertir en la compra de concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. El cuenta con varios cerdos y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para lograr un engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el mejor peso para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Serafín, 45, is married living with his wife and three children.  He intends to use the loan to buy concentrate to fatten up his pigs.  He has several pigs and he intends to feed them concentrate to fatten them up more quickly.  He wants his animals to be at better weight to the sell them at his local market or in surrounding areas.  He wants to earn the most profit possible for his and his family’s wellbeing and to grow with the pig raising project.  This is his first FUDECUSUR loan.  He has had no previous loans from state banks and FUDECOSUR offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for his pigs.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie is a 31-year-old married man with three children. The oldest child is 10 years old.

Eddie is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Eddie also manages a seedling nursery. He works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school.

Eddie requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. He hopes for his businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: After finishing junior high school, Nana has been cooking red-red in (a bean dish) in Jukwa for the last 4 years. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason. Nana will use the loan to buy beans, palm oil, gari and ripped plantain to cook to sell. The profits are used to assist her husband in caring for their family. The picture shows Nana frying the ripped plantain to be served with the cooked beans.

loans.use: to buy beans, palm oil, gari (casava grain) and ripped plantain to cook to sell.

loans.name: Justina Keli

texts.en:
Justina is a married Kenyan lady with two children. She is in the business of a retail shop, which is located within the estate and her customers are the people in the same estate. 

Justina sells such items as flour, sugar, eggs and beverages. She says that the business is good, but lately the prices of commodities such as sugar and flour have really skyrocketed, making it hard for her customers to afford. However, she opens the shop from early morning to late evening to ensure that the business is doing well. Her future hope is to open a wholesale shop, to build a house and to educate her children. Justina describes herself as trustworthy and honest.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, sugar, eggs, juice.

loans.name: Blanca Norma

texts.es:
Blanca de 50 años, una mujer muy empeñosa en su profesión. La actividad de ella es comercializar todo tipo  de ropa sea de hombre o de mujer.

Su actividad comienza de  9am hasta las  7pm, la dificultad de ella es la delincuencia de su sector donde vive.
Ella solicita este préstamo para invertir en su negocio e incrementar más la comercialización de su mercadería y para la compra de la misma.

El sueño de ella es mejorar su vivienda y tener un local fijo para la venta de su mercadería.
texts.en: Blanca, 50, is a woman who is very dedicated to her work.  She sells all sorts of clothes for men and women.  She starts her work day at 9am and goes until 7pm.  The difficulty she faces is crime in her neighborhood.  She’s asking for this loan to invest in the business buying clothes to increase sales.  Her dream is to improve her house and have a fixed locale to sell her merchandise in.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Lotonuu

texts.en:
Lotonuu is 24 years of age and married with one child. She has owned and operated a business hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members for 2 years. Lotonuu needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase additional scrap metal to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Lotonuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lotonuu's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional scrap metal to sell

loans.name: Bum-Erdene

texts.en:
Bum-Erdene is a 23-year-old young mother and entrepreneur who lives with her spouse and son in a small house in a ger district /district without basic infrastructure/ of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her son attends the local kindergarten while her husband works as an engineer at the trolleybus depot. 

She has been operating a clothing sales business since 2008. She usually sells men's suits, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. Now she has 3 million MNT/Mongolian Tugriks/ working capital. In the winter season, she sews handmade coats; therefore Bum-Erdene is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase coat materials so she can sew coats for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to purchase coat materials for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Nohemi; la socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos ; La socia ha cambiado de negocio,ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de pasteles,ella tiene una pasteleria donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella lleva los pasteles a diferentes pastelerias,por medio de este engcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasteles . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los pasteles como harina,mantequilla,azucar y manteca.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member is Nohemi.  She is 46 years old, lives with her live-in partner, and has three children.

The member has changed businesses.  Now she works selling cakes.  She has a cake shop where she works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She takes the cakes to various cakes shops.  By means of this business she gets her children ahead.

Nohemi wants to expand and improve her business selling cakes.  She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make cakes, such as flour, butter, sugar, and lard.

She is grateful for the support that will be given her and also is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cakes, such as flour, butter, sugar, and lard.

loans.name: Maiada

texts.en:
Maiada is a 21-year-old single lady who lives in Irbid with her family. Three years ago, with the help of her family, she started a small home business selling clothes and blankets to neighbors, friends, and relatives. Now, through word of mouth, knowledge of her business has reached more and more customers. Maiada has applied for this loan to buy more products and new winter fashions to attract more customers during this season. 
Because Maiada is a conservative person, she asked her brother Mohammad to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to buy more products and new winter fashions.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está  ubicada en el caserío Santa Elena caserio ubicado a unos 25 km en la parte rural de este distrito, su padre lo apoya en las actividades que realiza existe una buena relación familiar.

La actividad que desarrolla Juan es la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral, teniendo 10 cabezas y 12 pavos, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local a sus vecinos y comerciantes que llegan a la zona, además cuenta con 0.50 has de terreno agrícola que su padre le ha dado como herencia donde tiene limón en producción, generándole ingresos semanales para cubrir sus obligaciones crediticias.

Juan desea comprar alimento balanceado para el engorde de su ganado.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.  Esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo  y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 22 years old, single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in the rural community of Santa Elena which is about 25 kms from the same district.  His father helps him with his business and the family enjoys a good relationship.

Juan raises sheep and turkeys (he has 10 sheep and 12 turkeys) which he is fattening to sell at the local market to neighbors and merchants in the area.  He also has a half fanega of land that his father gave him where he grows lemons.  This generates a weekly income to cover his loan payments.

Juan wants to buy balanced feed for his livestock and has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  This investment will allow him to continue growing and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Heak

texts.en:
Heak, 32, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband, Duk, is a rice farmer. Besides growing rice, Duk purchases rice to resell at the rice mill to earn extra income during the harvest season. 

Heak is requesting a loan of USD 400 to raise capital for her husband to purchase rice to resell at the rice mill. In the future, she hopes to invest more money into expanding her husband’s business. In addition, she would like to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 31 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with two children. 

Melodia sells food every day to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 7000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase assorted ingredients for selling food in the market. 

Melodia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for two months. In the future, Melodia hopes to grow her business and be able to support the daily needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase assorted ingredients for selling food in the market

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 55 years old and a hard-working mother of five. She works as a teacher, and because of that she insists on getting her sons and daughters a good education and turning them into productive members of society. 

Her youngest son Abdallah is now a college student who wants to get his Bachelor degree in computer information system and then continue to get a Master's degree, too.

To help her son finish his education at the first level, Amal has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees. Because Amal is a conservative person, she asked her son Abdallah to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALAN, un des villages de BOUGOULA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz, l’arachide et le gombo avec  KOMOGOBA, 1ère personne debout  de la  droite  vers la  gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi I group are married women who on average are 36 years old with four children, all living in polygamous families in Falan, a village belonging to Bougoula, in the second administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their tenth seasonal loan with the institution.

The selected crops are rice, groundnuts and okra featuring Komogoba, the first person standing from right to left in the photo.

She intends to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and pay plowing costs to maintain 0.5 hectares (1.24 acres). After harvest, the production is sold at village level, to a client base of re-sellers and consumers.

She expects to make average profits of 75,000 CFA francs per growing season. These profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband deal with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Oripha

texts.en:
This is Oripha, a 33-year-old woman who is full of smiles.

She is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her two children. She is very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Kiirua, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. This area has tough living conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Oripha has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past 6 years. 

Her primary sources of income are poultry,crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. Oripha is contented with the farming way of life. 

Oripha is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal education or formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family a decent meal. The Kiirua, Nkubu area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Kenya is very challenging, but Oripha feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as KIVA that help enterprising women like her. Oripha is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children, who are in primary school. 

As the December season is approaching, Oripha wants to close the year on a high note. Please help Oripha so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: to start horticulture farming and provide a better life for her two children

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
Miguel, se dedica a vender productos plásticos en las principales calles de la ciudad y sus alrededores, actividad que desarrolla desde hace cinco años, recibió capacitaciones para realizar su trabajo, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y dos hijos, uno de ellos ya se gradúo de bachillerato y por el momento se encuentra desempleado, mientras que su pareja tiene su negocio propio pero independiente del que él tiene.
Con el crédito podrá aumentar la mercadería que vende, tiene definido comprar encendedores, guacales, coladores, peladores,  etc., para seguir recorriendo las calles de la ciudad con mejor calidad y variedad de productos.
Sus anhelos son obtener mayores ingresos, resarcir sus deudas y llevar el sustento diario a su familia.

loans.use: omprar encendedores, guacales, coladores, peladores,  etc., para seguir recorriendo las calles de la ciudad con mejor calidad y variedad de productos

loans.name: Maria Petra

texts.en:
Petrita lives with her five children, for whom she works very hard, in San Nicolas, Nuevo Leon. She started her business to help cover family expenses seeing as her husband\'s salary was not enough. She was also faced with the medical expenses of her sick child who passed away, one that she thinks of with so much love. She sells beauty products and the income has helped her support her family.

She needs a loan of $700 to buy Mary Kay products to meet the demand for those items. During this holiday season she hopes to see an increase in her sales which will help her continue to support her family. She thanks you for your help and for your kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Petrita vive en San Nicolás Nuevo León, tiene 5 hijos de familia por los cuales trabaja muy duro todos los días. Inició su negocio ante la necesidad de contribuir con los gastos de la familia ya que el salario de su esposo no es suficiente para cubrirlos. Además para enfrentas los gastos de la enfermedad y muerte de uno de sus hijos, que hasta el momento Petrita lo recuerda con mucho cariño. Ella vende productos de belleza y esto le ha permitido apoyar a la familia.

Ella necesita un préstamo de $700 DLLS para comprar productos de belleza “Mary Key” para enfrentar el incremento de demanda por sus artículos, debido a estas temporadas navideñas ella espera que sus ingresos aumenten y seguir apoyando a su familia como lo hace hasta ahora. Tú puedes contribuir con su propósito, ella agradece tu ayuda y cariño.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Ahad

texts.en:
This 57-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children.

Having borrowed $600, Ahad repaired the medical clinic. He opened this clinic 15 years ago. Now Ahad needs a loan of $1000 to buy medicines and equipment.

Ahad is a doctor (general practioner). Patients come to him and complain about their pains: belly-ache, chest pain, back pain, abdomen pain, etc. and Ahad does a general patient examination.

loans.use: To buy medicine and equipment

loans.name: Faalaniga

texts.en: Faalaniga is a 52-year old woman with seven children.  All of her children remain in school.  She is very proud of her ability to provide an education for each of them, and she attributes her ability to do that to her successful weaving business.  And for her weaving talent, she says that she thanks God.  Faalaniga has been an active SPBD member for four years now, and says that it is through consistent access to the micro-loan facilities that she has been able to ensure that she can get enough bulk supply of weaving leaves and decorative materials to be able to guarantee a consistent supply to her customers and the timely fulfillment of orders.  A loan to Faalaniga will help her continue to do what she has already proven she can do:  provide for herself and her children.

loans.use: Weaving leaves and decorative materials

loans.name: Mardan

texts.en: Marden is 36 years old, and has two children. He lives in Agyazi Budug, located in the Khachmaz region. He has been in his business for four years, and would like a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizer and medicines.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicines

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas N., 38, lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling grocery products to the people in her area, where she can earn on average about $13 each day in revenue. Her husband and one of her children, meanwhile, work at a carpentry shop, earning together about $4.30 each day. The other children are students.

Mrs. Meas N. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding extra grocery products and to buy a motorcycle for her business transportation needs.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding extra grocery products and to buy a motorcycle for her business transportation

loans.name: Alicia Vargas

texts.en:
Alicia is a 34-year-old mother of three who sells homemade pastries, specializing in birthday and wedding cakes. Her husband owns and operates a small general store within walking distance of their home. Alicia’s youngest child, a two-year-old girl, is still at home with Mom, while her two elder children, a girl and boy ten and five years old, respectively, attend school.

Currently, Alicia sells her cakes from inside the family’s home but is planning on building a small luncheon counter next to her husband’s store, where she can display her pastries but also serve an assortment of food. She explains that her pastry sales are quite profitable but the quantity of cakes Alicia sells in a given month varies with the number of special events celebrated in her community.

With her loan Alicia hopes to invest in more of the ingredients she uses in her cakes, but also to begin purchasing the construction materials for her business’s storefront.

loans.use: Purchase of Pastry Ingredients and Construction Materials for new store

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. Him S., age 38, is a wedding director and earns about $3.50 a day.  Her husband is a photographer, earning about $3.50 a day.  The couple has one child, who is a full-time student.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase additional wedding clothes for her inventory, taking advantage of the big demand for wedding garments.  She plans to use additional income from the loan to help support her child’s education and expand her business in other ways.

loans.use: To purchase wedding clothes to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Yeat (42), and her husband, Mr. Pich Touch have been married since 1990. They have four children — two sons and two daughters. Two of their children are studying at a local school; their oldest son is helping them with their farming business and the youngest one stays at home.  Yeat and her family live on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She and husband are in the business of doing farming, raising cows and running horse carts since 1985. After borrowing money again and again to expand their business, they are now in the position to save money to build their new house (shown in the photo).

Yeat is requesting her seventh loan for $1000. She will use this loan to add to her own money to build the house.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Usuf

texts.ru:
Usuf D. is 44 years old, he is married and has 8 children. He has a high school diploma and his profession is accounting. Currently, Usuf has an agricultural business; he grows potatoes. He has 15 years of experience in this business. Usuf plans to use his loan to purchase seed potatoes. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months. His business helps provide agricultural products to the community.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Давлатов Юсуф Раджабович.Возраст44 года, женат имеет 8 детей.Образование среднее по специальности бухгалтер. Занимается сельским хозяйством по посадке картофеля.Опыт работы в данной деятельности 15 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы закупить семена картофеля. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.Его бизнес позволяет обеспечить население сельхоз -продукцией.

loans.use: To purchase seed potatoes

loans.name: Anna Rosanny's Group

texts.en:
Anna Rosanny is the coordinator of a group of five women, all of whom carry on businesses in San Cristobal.

Anna Rosanny is 32 years old and is a well-educated woman. She attends to an English course because “Speaking a global language opens the gate to prosperity”, she says. Anna Rosanny owns and operates clothing store which she started seven years ago. Her store offers a collection of fashionable clothing to women, men and children of the community. Anna hopes that her business can grow enough so she can start a branch office in another area of San Cristobal. Together with other four entrepreneurs, Anna is requesting a loan to boost her business. The loan funds will be distributed among the group, and each entrepreneur will invest in her own business.

The other members of the group are:

Denny Margarita F. N., a young entrepreneur which sells an assortment of pants in the same community.

Adriana N., an experienced businesswoman that has been selling fresh meat for ten years.

Lucía Esperanza R. A., a young and budding entrepreneur. She sells silver jewelry and is finishing a small location to run her business.

Gaudy Nereyda C. A. also sells silver jewelry.

NOTE: Members of the group warrant one another’s loans. If one member fails in repaying the loan, the other members will have to take the responsibility.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk, silver jewelry and other goods for several businesses.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is forty-six years old, a widow and the mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She has been selling fresh eggs to bakers, caterers, and cooks for the past two years.

Mary buys the eggs from a local farm. She wants to use her loan to buy more crates of eggs so that she can supply to food vendors, caterers, cooks, and matrons.

She is a member of the group called Destiny. Members of the group use peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs.

loans.name: Hai Tarawa 2018-1 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is 36-year-old Rejoice P., who sells breads. She and her husband have four children ranging from age 7 to 18 who attend school.
