Each week Rejoice makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Rejoice is joined in her small group by Joice G., Modong C., Roda R., and Rose L.. Joice G. has a grocery business and wants to construct an oven. Modong C. currently sells beer and wants a loan to construct a shop. Roda R. operates a business brewing alcohol and wants to open up a bar. Rose L. currently sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Leah J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Leah L.. She is married and has two children aged 5 and 2. She has six dependents who live with her because they are relatives. In 2005, Leah established her tailoring business. Leah requires a loan in order to buy additional cloth. In the future, Leah plans to invest in a small business for cloth-making. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy additional cloth.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei C. lives in Zaporozhye, Ukraine, where he is a successful businessman who has been selling a variety of perfumes, leather goods, and glass products over the past 10 years. The father of two grown children, he provides the family's only income. Sergei has two vending locations in the market, where he makes a net profit of about $500 per month. He has invested about $2400 in his business.

Sergei is requesting a seasonal loan of $550 with which to re-stock his inventory and purchase seasonal merchandise. This loan will increase his business sales, allowing Sergei to diversify his merchandise and better provide for his family.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory.

loans.name: Lawerence

texts.en: Lawrence owns and runs a palm-kernel farm. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where he has been in this business since 1998. He needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more pesticides and weed-control chemicals to use on his plantation.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and weed-control chemicals

loans.name: Slavojka

texts.en: Slavojka is a widow from the town of Doboj. She receives her husband's pension in the amount of 400 KM. Together with her daughter, she owns a tailoring shop. Slavojka is requesting a loan in the amount of 600 KM to buy additional material for their sewing needs. She hopes this will help her offer better products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy material for sewing.

loans.name: Meay

texts.en: Meay Y., 47, sells small vegetables at a local market in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is married with two children, who are still living at home. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. She typically earns around US$6 each day. She is requesting a loan of US$700 to replace an old and unreliable motorbike for her husband. The old one uses a lot of gas and needs to be fixed often which costs a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarith M. was born in 1961. She lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province.

She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice, which is how she earns a living. On her plantation, she faces a small problem - her field is infertile. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sarith M. has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy fertilizers to support the field and make her crop more productive.

Her husband Mr. Oem Sareth helps his wife on the plantation.

Mrs. Sarith M. has four children. They all attend the local school.

Mr. Oem Sareth is presented on the left photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her farm

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab G. is 28 years old. She is married with two adorable children. 

Zainab sells men’s clothing, such as jackets, suits, and trousers, in the local market. She started her business 9 years ago. At that time, her husband, who is also an entrepreneur, supported Zainab by providing the funds for her start-up. Gradually, Zainab's business has expanded. Hardworking and polite by nature, she has managed to obtain a clientele that is happy with her goods and services. The business generates a stable income for the family. Zainab loves her children very much and she wants all of them to be well educated. 

Today, she is requesting 2500 Somoni ($750 USD) for 8 months. She is planning to spend the loan to purchase additional clothes for the cold season. 

You can become an important part in Zainab's family's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving to her.

loans.use: To purchase men’s clothing

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with one son, Igor. She sells children’s clothing items in the local Osipenkovskyi market in Zaporozhye. She has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, her gross income is about 6000 Grivnas. She has 12,000 Grivnas in inventory. 

Alla is lucky to have a convenient vending kiosk in the local market. She always has many customers who keep coming back to her kiosk for she has very reasonable prices. Loans through Nadiya Ukraine have stimulated consistent growth of her business. Alla would like to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase available products in her kiosk. We believe her hard work, natural friendliness, good customer service and self-discipline will help Alla use the funds received wisely and repay her loan on time. 

This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is currently in the business of selling fresh fish at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Susan is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Doña Juana trabaja en servicio de domestica desde hace quince años donde ha estado en la misma casa por la confianza de su patrona, trabajo que ha dedicado con sus esfuerzos para mantener a su familia, tiene 43 años de edad, sus hijos son cuatros de 14,15118 y 20 años de edad, todos estudian, su esposo es misionero y apoya a su hogar  como a sus hijos. Sus planes de la Sra. Juana es poder tener su propio negocio para dejar de trabajar por que quiere algo mejor para el futuro de sus hijos, esta es la cuarta solicitud en Afodenic y con este dinero va a comprar medicamentos populares como: panadol, zepol, pastilla de desparasitante, entre otros, para salir a vender y poder salir adelante. Espera en Dios que todo le salga bien y poder captar clientes y hacer su su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Juana has worked in domestic service for fifteen years where she has been in the same house due to the trust of her employer. This is work that she has dedicated her efforts to in order to support her family. She is 43 years old. Her four children are 14, 15,18 and 20 years of age. All of them study. Her husband is a missionary and he supports his home as well as his children. Juana's plans are to be able to have her own business so she may leave her job because she wants something better for the future of her children. This is the fourth loan from Afodenic and, with this money, she is going to buy popular medications such as panadol, zepol, deworming pills, among others so she can go out and sell and be able to get ahead. She hopes in God that everything will turn out well and she can find customers and create a small business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general medications such as panadol, zepol, among others to sell.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida K. is married and the mother of three kids who are currently in school. She is a 32-year-old trader. She lives with her husband and children in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a very hard-working woman who has been struggling to cater for her children for five years now. She trades in garment cloths and lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.

Vida treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, Vida buys only a few stocks of lace materials and garment cloths and sells through hawking. For this reason she is requesting loan support for her business to make business progress.

Vida believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials, garment cloths, and textile in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Awurade Yekese’ which means ‘God is Big’. She hopes to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: R.c Teko (Upper) Group

texts.en:
This will be the first loan the teachers at RC Teko (Upper) are requesting from SMT/Kiva.  With this loan, some of the teachers will invest in businesses in order to supplement their monthly salaries. Some of them will use it buy pieces of furniture like a bed or chairs, while others will use it to pay school fees either for themselves or for their children. 

Ibrahim K. (first row right) is the head master of RC Teko (Upper). He has been a teacher for over nineteen years now. Ibrahim was born in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. He is age forty-nine, married to a businesswoman and they have five children. One of their child is in nursery, the other is in class II, the other is in Junior Secondary School I (JSS I) and the eldest is in Senior Secondary School I (SSS I). Mr. Kargbo will use his loan to buy house building materials like cements and corrugated iron zincs. This will enable him start building a house and with the help of subsequent loans, he is optimistic that he will be able to complete building a house for himself and children. 

RC Teko School was established by the Roman Catholics in 1977 with the aim of educating the children of military personnel at the Makeni Military barracks, Teko, and to spread the Roman Catholic faith. RC Teko is divided into a Lower and Upper primary schools respectively. The Lower is made up of classes I – III and the Upper is made of classes IV – V. RC Teko (Upper) has a total of sixteen staff and 435 pupils.

Amongst the many constrains that this school suffers are the lack of sufficient class-rooms and seating accommodations for the pupils. However, they do make good grades at the National Primary School Examination (NPSE). They also organize sports for the pupils, and last academic year, they emerged victorious at the Inter Catholics Primary Schools Sports.

loans.use: Personal Use

loans.name: Mardamkul

texts.ru: Мардамкул - мужчина 47 лет. Разведенный. Живет с одной дочкой. Мардамкул занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Он закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает на том же рынке. Дочка занимается переработкой шерсти скота и продает ее на рынке, и еще помогает по хозяйству дома. Этим она помогает отцу, чтобы их семейный бюджет улучшился. Мардамкул в свою очередь хочет увеличить количество своего скота.
texts.en:
Mardamkul is a 47-year-old man. He is divorced, and lives with his daughter. Mardamkul raises and sells large- and small-horned cattle. He purchases cattle at the market, fattens them for two to three months, and sells them again at the same market. His daughter processes the wool, sells it at the market, and additionally helps out on the farm. She assists her father in order to help the family financially. Mardamkul, in turn, would like to increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Rincon Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Rincón Poty se encuentra trabajando en la ciudad de Ñemby, en la zona de Rincón, desde hace cerca de dos años; han aprendido a conocerse y a organizarse atendiendo a su realidad. Todas las semanas pagan una pequeña cuota para su caja chica y son un excelente comité. Han ayudado a la conformación de otros comités en la zona donde residen.
 
En promedio reciben cada una 572.727 gs.

Las integrantes del comite son:  

1	Miguela López	- Despensa - 
2	Dionicia M. - 	Venta de Cosméticos - 
3	Ignacia F. - 	Venta de frutas -

15	Ramona R.	 - Venta de Cosmeticos -

texts.en:
The Rincón Poty group has been found working in the city of Ñemby in the region of Rincón for about 2 years. They have gotten to know each other and have learned to organize themselves heeding their reality. Every week they pay a small fee for their small amount of funds, and they are an excellent committee. They have helped other groups to form in the region where they reside. On average they each receive 572.727 gs. The members of the committee are: 1 Miguela López - Pantry - 2 Dionicia M. - Cosmetic Sales - 3 Ignacia F. - Fruit Sales - 4 Silvina S. - Cosmetic Sales - 5 Constancia S. - Clothing Sales - 6 Angelica A. - Clothing Sales - 7 Mirtha V. - Hairdresser - 8 Ana O. - Lingerie Sales - 9 Evarista G. - Kiosk - 10 Adolfina L. - Basket Sales - 11 Sonia C. - Charcoal Sales - 12 Juana Servín - Pantry - 13 Ignacia E. - Charcoal Sales - 14 Ana D. - Pantry - 15 Ramona R. - Cosmetic Sales - 16 Lidia T. - Kiosk - 17 Carmen M. - Sales of Argentinean Products - 18 Susana G. - Dressmaker - 19 Teodolina S. - Manager - 20 Luz O. - Food Sales - 21 Lilian A. - Pastry Cook - 22 Marcelina C. - Fruit and Vegetable Sales -

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams and perfumes, peppers, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, bananas, pineapples, oranges, drinks, bread, flour, sweets, grass,sugar, wine, starch, eggs, cheese, charcoal and other products to make food or desserts

loans.name: Felicitas Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” ubicado en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos a su cargo, vive en el Jr. Julia H. Paredes Nº 454, Barrio Vilca Apaza, ella posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año y medio, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual compró diversos productos para su bodega.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1800.00 nuevos soles, comprará diferentes productos como fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc., además comprara  golosinas, y alimento para engorde de su ganado.  Quiere tener más ganancia para poder poner una tienda mas grande.

Asi mismo ella refiere que le gusta mucha el método de trabjo de Manuela Ramos, sobre todo los ahorros y también le gusta las charlas.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi community bank, which is located in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 31, married, and has three children to care for. She lives at Jr. Julia H. Paredes Nº 454, Vilca Apaza neighborhood. She has a high school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one and a half years. She buys and sells groceries. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy various products for her grocery store. With this loan for 1,800 PEN, she will buy different products like noodles, rice, sugar, oil, milk etc. She will also buy sweets and food to fatten her livestock. She wants to have more income to be able to set up a larger store. She really likes the way Manuela Ramos works; above all she likes the savings. She also likes the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, noodles, milk, flour

loans.name: Atanga Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is married with eight children, two of whom are below 15 years old. She lives at Mile 3 Nkwen, Bamenda, North West Province. Emelda plans to invest her loan in pig rearing and crop farming of crops. She will increase her pig style, buy more piglets, feed, and farm inputs.

This is Emelda’s fifth loan from GHAPE. She became a member in 2004 and since then her repayments have been satisfactory. This loan will help her expand her pig rearing business and cultivate a large portion of land for greater yields. She is convinced this business will succeed because she has experience in the business and it will help her community by providing food stuff.

She plans to use the profit from the loan to pay school fees for her children, cloth them, give them good medical attention, and even feed the family. She also intends to diversify her activities with a provision store in her house.

Emelda prefers to receive a loan from GHAPE because the method of repayment is comfortable and convenient, GHAPE offers training, and there is proper follow-up when the loan is disbursed to ensure it is properly managed.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy piglets, cement for a fence, pig feed, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony A. is 32 years old. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl. Both are currently in the primary school. He lives with his children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Anthony is a hard-working man. He runs a provision store with his wife. He sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. He has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand his business. He is hoping to improve his standard of living and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Felista's Group

texts.en: Felista N. is a 54-year-old mother of 4 children aged from 30 to 16 years and she cares for 5 dependants. Felista has a grocery store that has been in existence for 16 years, with challenges including seasonal changes and bad debtors. In her store, she sells eats and refreshments like sodas and cold drinks. She has been able to educate her children single-handedly with the help of loans after her husband died when they were still young, and she is so grateful for being able to do so. Felista needs a loan to help buy more stock for her grocery store. She is a member of the Bakyala Kwekulakulanya group in Lugazi.

loans.use: Buying more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is married and has one child. She was educated through primary school. Janet sells groceries at Atabadze near Elmina, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a trader. Janet uses her income to pay for school fees and other bills. She will use the loan to expand her business by purchasing more groceries for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Godilla

texts.en:
Godilla N. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 59 years old. Godilla is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Godilla owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as lobster (commonly known as "talaba") in the local community. Godilla has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Godilla joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Godilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Godilla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Godilla from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer sells jewelry. This business is her only source of income and she hopes to make profits. She is 33 years old and married with three children.

Jennifer hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Por Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL
POR SIEMPRE AMIGAS
           Por  siempre amigas se caracteriza por ser un grupo de personas que busca la superación personal y el bienestar para sus familias, están ubicadas en distrito del Agustino.
          Una de las socias es la Sra. Flor Huamán, ella comenzó su negocio de sándwich con chocolate caliente hace muchos años en el paradero de una empresa de transporte, este negocio le ocupa poco tiempo y así puede dedicarse más a su familia.
          Grimanesa Díaz inicio su negocio como comerciante cuando su esposo perdió el empleo, ella afrontó muchos problemas los cuales pudieron resolverlos juntamente con su familia.
           La venta de comida durante el día y salchipapas en las noches ha sido muy beneficioso para la Sra. Carmen P. ya que ella tiene 5 hijos que aun están en el colegio los cuales necesitan de su ayuda y protección.
           Así como ellas todos los socios tienen diferentes negocios tales como comidas, Cebichería, venta productos de belleza, productos textiles, comida rápida, buffet y otros.
           Los socios vienen trabajando con la institución hace siete años, son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. El crédito solicitado lo invertirán para comprar productos e insumos que le ayudaran a obtener  mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Por Siempre Amigas (Friends Forever) is characterized as being a group of women that strive for personal success and the well being of their families. They are located in the district of Agustino.

One of the partners is Mrs. Flor Huamán. She started her sandwich and hot chocolate business many years ago in the station of a transportation company. This business only occupies some of her time and she remains dedicated to her family.

Grimanesa Díaz started her business as a merchant when her husband lost his job. She faced many problems which she resolved with the help of her family.

Food sales during the day and salchipapa (sliced hot dogs and french fries) sales during the night have benefited Mrs. Carmen P.. She has five children that are still in secondary school and who need her help and protection.

All of the partners have different businesses; for example some sell beauty products, textiles and fast food while others run ceviche restaurants and buffets. These women have been working with this Kiva field partner for seven years. They are responsible and punctual with their repayments. The loan requested will be invested in the purchasing of products and goods that help them increase their profits.


Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS E INSUMOS

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Knitted cradle vending is the business of Rosario V. from Barangay Agoluan of Echague, ISabela. She lives there with her husband and three children who are Alejandro - 24 years old, is an elementary graduate;Diana Rose - 21 years old just ended in high school and the youngest is Rogelio V. Jr. - 19 years old. 

Rosario wanted to improve her selling business but she do nott have enough capital to use. In this regard. Rosario realize to seek for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital to grow her business. 
 
Rosario and her husband Rogelio V. Sr. strive hard for the fulfillment of her family dreams in life. She hopes that she could be able to achieve success someday through the help of Kiva. She further said that she could be able to achieve success if she will continue working on towards the improvement of her business.

loans.use: additional capital for business improvement
